Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: I used to bring my family here as a treat. The burgers were to.die.for! Big fat yummy, tender, juicy, seasoned ground beef, just like dad used to bbq. Today, I got a tough, tasteless, cardboard replica of a Sams club or Costco bulk frozen patty. Since when does 100% ground beef have 90 degree hard edges? The bun was soaked in grease, and it was essentially a crunchy chewy greasy blob of gunk. The saving grace were the fries and beautifully blended Coke. (Note: your $7.99 burger only comes as a burger - no fries, salad or even a pickle. Your fries are gonna set you back another three bucks on any dog, sandwich or entree.) I'm so sad. When I was craving an old fashioned thick, juicy, tasty burger on a toasted warm bun, I'd run to Great Links. Now, I'm off south bound to SkinnyFats.

Reviews.Author: Eduardo
Reviews.Content: I literally pass by this place every single day.  Always, was curious and a friend, said it was good. So what the hell. First and foremost, the menu is extensive. Every type of hot dog, made every way possible, with every topping you could ever imagine. Not only that, but they had burgers as well and sandwiches. They had you're mushroom burger, patty melts, and some creative burgers with ingredients I have never seen mixed together. Very original. I had the Pastrami Melt. Good old pastrami, grilled onions, mustard and swill on grilled rye. It was dead on, geat sandwich, very filling. For 5.99$ I was very satisfied. I had some of the italian fries. Those were good, I wish they put a little bit more of the garlic butter, and a little less parmesan cheese. That might just be me though, whenever butter is part of the equation, you better use a lot of it, or not at all. Go big or go home. I had a bite of the patty melt, my friend had. very delicious. This is small operation that obviously knows what they are doing and have a great thing going. I am a fan, and will go here more, the menu is so big, it entices you to come back and try the other stuff.

Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: Popped in here because I needed a cheap bite to eat and saw the good yelp reviews. I was not disappointed. The burgers are even better than they look. I'll be back here when I visit Vegas next.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: Being the only non-meat-eater in the house - I'm normally limited to salads, grilled cheese or fries when we go eat out for a quick lunch. This place was definitely a compromise with a great reward!   They will substitute any menu item that has meat in it with the vegetarian option of it (veggie chicken patty, burger patty, bacon, and chili)...they can also substitute turkey too.  The food the rest of the family had was enjoyed just as much...will definitely be back! Staff was great and place was clean.  The only thing I would recommend is that if your at a table where there is veggie and non-veggie orders being placed - order the veggie item first as there was a gap of about 10 minutes between the food coming out. (they do indicate on their menu that veggie items take a few minutes longer).

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Perhaps my trip this restaurant was just a stray from the norm, or perhaps the people that review this place have never been to a quality burger and dog type place.   I gave this restaurant a fair shot and was excited based on Yelp reviews. Yelp rarely fails me but this was one of those times where it fell short of expectations.   Is there a good-ole-boy system at this place? All I heard the owner talking about was their award winning burgers to whom I supposed are the regulars. My wife, daughter and I were the only people under the age of 50 there, so perhaps that explains why their food was so bland and flavorless.   I ordered the pastrami, which was cooked really well. However, there was little taste. I have tried pastrami from dozens of restaurants and this was bottom-of-the-barrell in terms of taste.   My wife ordered grilled cheese, which is impossible to screw up unless you're 4 years old or completely inept. It was solid, but she ordered it with bacon and bacon saves everything. The bread was alright, but seemed store-bought.   My daughter ordered chicken nuggets and she said they were disgusting. I looked at them and they appeared to be the type you buy from a frozen food section.   We shared fries, which apparently do not come with any sort of salt or seasoning.   To be fair, the waitresses there were super friendly and on top of their game. I hope the owner realizes this and recognizes them accordingly.   What I found off-putting on a personal level was that the owner came out and greeted every single table, asked about their experience and bragged about their food.... except for our table. He also missed a kid run into the restaurant, grab two soda cups, fill them and leave without paying. All because he was too busy bragging about his food to the NASCAR crowd that was infesting this place.   One of the cooks also took the time to venture into the diner and talk about the burger competition they had previously won. he oddly went out of his way to state that  I don't think they'll want us back next year. Not that we're cheating but...  and I didn't catch the end.   Overall, I was pretty disappointed with this place considering the positive reviews on yelp. I will eventually give this place another chance to redeem itself and, if it isn't able to, I'll suspect that they are asking friends and family to circumvent the yelp reviews.   Either that or they rarely get anyone who isn't an AARP member and can actually handle salt and seasoning.

Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: As a kid growing up in home were mom didn't work, we rarely ate hot dogs. She always cook for us. When we did picnic's at the lake, or camping which we did a lot in the summer months, we'd eat hot dogs roasted over an open flame. Chili cheese dogs came later, and I didn't get to experience gourmet dogs until my adult years.   Today we tried Great Links, and I was surprised at the different variations of hot dogs. If you want new experience try this place. I had the  Chicago dog with fried zucchini sticks. My husband ordered the chili cheese fries with the New York hot dog.   The bun became soggy with the liquid from the relish? And when I went to pick mine up, it kinda fell apart in my hand, and with each bite, the toppings fell off and the hot dog came through the bottom of the bun. We watched the guy make them, so we know they were not sitting for a while, but still yet, who likes a soggy bun?   The flavors of the peppers, pickle, tomato, onions, and green relish worked well together, the hot dog itself had a little snap to it, so I assume it was close to the real thing, however, I would try a different dog next time. As for the sides, the zucchini sticks were plentiful and had good crisp to them, but the chili on the fries did seem canned.   For a hot dog, this place was just okay. I'd try it again, just because of the variety on the menu. The staff were friendly and the atmosphere was very relaxed.

Reviews.Author: Jalen
Reviews.Content: Wow! This was amazing! I had the Las Vegas Chili Dog and it was so unique and good! The workers were super friendly and will definitely go back again

Reviews.Author: Jaimie
Reviews.Content: Love their hot dogs and tater tots. I can pass on their burgers although  they have won a few burger competitions.  That sage chili tho! So freaking good! I can put that on almost anything and it will still be good. It's like crack! GET IT! IT'S A MUST!  Seems like a friendly atmosphere to eat.  I usually to go orders  here. The workers a  nice. It does get busy and is a small place so I prefer to just  enjoy my  food at home.

Reviews.Author: Orlando
Reviews.Content: Love this place!!! Didn't look like much walking in, but the food & variety are outstanding. People are extremely friendly & they go out of their way to make sure your experience is fantastic.

Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: Alright, I went to this place after reading the great reviews. So maybe my experience was based off good expectations. However, I ordered the southern hot dog and my wife got the Chicago dog. I also got home-style fries and she got the mozzarella sticks.   The hot dogs were alright and tasted pretty good, nothing amazing and I found them comparable to Sonic's hot dogs.  The mozzarella sticks probably came straight from the freezer from Costco or the like and were nothing original.  The home-style french fries were disgusting. I think they let the potatoes set out too-long, because the fries tasted bad, were very soggy, and lacked any taste other than oil. I do not know how it is possible to have a burned soggy fry.  The service was horrible. The owner was there when we went and it was not busy at all, but we had to wait 15 minutes to order even though our waitress was sitting directly in-front of us watching Sponge-bob Square-pants. We were clearly ready to order for at least five minutes before because we decided to fold our menus up to make it even more obvious that we were ready to go. When we left, we went through a similar situation, not sure if we should just walk up to the cash register at the front or wait for somebody to come to our table. We finally decided to ask somebody to ring us up and we were off.  This was a really lame experience, especially after the great reviews.

Reviews.Author: mick
Reviews.Content: Yes this is an update...1st of all incredible array of hot dog offerings..if they don't have it listed, they will make the dog for you!! Decided to go in the burger direction this time.....Probably had the best Patty melt I've ever had. It was cooked to order, medium..nicley grilled onions and your choice of cheese. I can see why they won the burger wars...they deserve it. While i was waiting was offered a free small soda..It you want a great dog or burger make this a distination stop. Staff is very help ful they will assist you in every way to make your repast good.....Enjoy

Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went there on Sunday for lunch. I ordered the ball park dog, which has mustard, ketchup, relish and onions.. sounds good-hmm, and beer battered onion rings with a diet pop.  My husband ordered a kielbasa sausage, Italian fries and a diet pop.  Lets start off with the chopped onion on my hotdog!  the onion was chopped in quite large pieces and there were WAY TOO MANY PEICES ON ONE HOTDOG!! It tasted like they used the relish that has the cloves in it, so I didn't care for the relish on there, and they put soooo much mustard on it and barely any ketchup at all.. all in all, I was very disappointed with my hotdog.  The onion rings were quite tasty, light and crispy, just the way I like them.  My husbands purchase, well it came on a bun with the sausage cut into four small pieces, he took one out and it is the way they cooked it! so it kept falling apart on him, they didn't drain the sauerkraut that was put onto it so the bun got very soggy.. I don't know if anyone else likes sauerkraut juice dripping from your bun, but he sure didn't.  His Italian fries came with some kind of Italian seasoning and parm. cheese and olive oil. They put so much olive oil on his fries that when he was done eating them, there had to be at least a half a cup of oil in the bottom of his dish, they put way too much oil on them... he was very disappointed with both the sausage and the fries that he ordered... when we first got there he asked them to turn the tv down, we were really close to it, and they turned it down one... they have two tvs in there and my husband and I were the only customers in there at the time he asked them to turn it down, so that just wasn't right of them... when we first walked in and the waitress came and took our order I noticed she had gloves on, I was thinking that was good.. If I had realized that they don't change their gloves in between orders.. (they didn't that day while we were there) we would have asked them to change them. The guy that was working was walking around running his hands along the counters and knocking on the counters and touching it seemed everything then he didn't change his gloves when other people came in there... she didn't either.  We definitely will not be back to this place.. THE ONLY REASON I PUT TWO STARS ON HERE IS BECAUSE THEY DID HAVE GOOD ONION RINGS!

Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: The family loves everything we have tried! Burgers and Tenders are great. Kids love the cheese steak and chicken sandwhiches. The favorite of the many sides have been the cottage fries. Oh, and they even have draft rootbeer!

Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: My kids and I went here to grab some take out just a couple days ago. The pro's- The Italian fries were tasty. Parmigian with garlic and a bit of oil. The chili cheeseburger was good....but here's the thing. The con's- shortly after we arrived there and placed our order, the manager and or owner was well within earshot, telling....yelling at one of his (former?) employees that he was  f'ing fired! . Extremely loud. The other employees seemed a bit shaken up, so maybe that explains the quality of our food. The chili cheese dog was ok. It seemed under cooked. Again, maybe  it was the situation.  Definitely willing to give this place another chance, seeing how favorably this place is reviewed....

Reviews.Author: Jody
Reviews.Content: Great selection of dogs, burgers, chicken and fries.  The dill of the side menu is highly recommended.  Chili fries are a must

Reviews.Author: Javi
Reviews.Content: This review is for the one across the street from Nellis Air Force base. Amanda was the server and then the corporate manager came over to introduce himself and took on my yelp challenge. Sweet tea is house brewed. She explained the menu to us, and recommend a few tweaks that she likes.  Then someone brought over a few samples of the  Vegas chilli  it was awesome. Japeleno guacamole burger, onion rings Chicago dog hoagie and Italian fries is what we ordered. The burger is huge. The hoagie dog is filling. And the fries were on point. We will be back.

Reviews.Author: JimBo
Reviews.Content: Wife and I love this place! Some of the best food around and the best service with faces that are always familiar. Gotta love small business with the right attitude! We'll come here as long as you guys are here!!!

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I've been slipping on writing some Yelp reviews lately...I write so many papers for my major that often I don't feel like writing a creative accolade for the places that I do enjoy. But for Great Links, I'll make the exception.  When I was 17, I was having the time of my life running around Philly and Brooklyn.  I was on an extended vacation (months) visiting my relatives and was bouncing between the two cities. It was my first east coast experience, and it was incredible. What I remember the most was not the sights and the sounds, but it was the food. OMG the food...how I miss it.  Great Links is able to bring me a little slice of what I remember and loved most about Brooklyn and Philly. Another reviewer said it best: The moment you step inside the doors, you don't feel like you're in Vegas anymore. Suddenly you're in a casual, intimate little retro diner where you can place your order at the front, or grab a barstool at the counter and watch the cooks prepare your food. Heck, you're so close you could even chat with them - but I try not to, because they're busy cooking 20 things at once. For the east coast, these types of joints litter every street corner. For Vegas, it's not so common. It makes it all the more special.  Everyone there is really nice. The cooks/grillmasters are awesome and very talented - I can't seem to cook more than one thing at a time without burning it all on MY stove, so how they manage to do it so well is beyond me. They chat to the customers when they can, and make sure that you're doing ok. The servers are also friendly and attentive. I've even met the owner, and he's a very personable guy. And he works hard too, because I've watched him bus tables when it gets really busy. I've never seen a owner do dirty work at any other restaurant, so he has my respect.  The menu is extensive and delicious.The portions are huge and extremely affordable. They have more than hot dogs for those not in the mood, as well as salads for those of you that are a little more health-conscious (I am not one of those people). They have a breakfast menu that I'd like to try someday - if I can ever convince myself to wake up before noon on my days off.  In addition to the food, they have the usual soft drinks, milk shakes, malt beverages, bottled beer, and even some beer on tap. Never have tried a milkshake, because I usually get filled up on my entree, but they look good, and I am tempted.  During lunch rush hour, expect to wait a little bit longer for your food. This is not a slam against the restaurant - everything is prepared fresh, and it gets seriously busy. I don't mind waiting the extra few minutes for good food. I believe you can call ahead and place a to-go order - so if you're short on time and not dining in, this might be a better way to go.  I can't say enough good things. I am a happy customer, and I'm pretty picky about where I spend my money. I appreciate a place that serves good food and brings back happy memories of a long-time-ago.

Reviews.Author: Krystal
Reviews.Content: I really, really, really wanted a hotdog, after googling a few local places, my hunny brought me here. The selection was awesome and since everything is a la carte, you aren't locked into a combo meal you don't really want. We shared a small shoestring fry and each got two dogs, a plain and a specialty.   The hotdogs themselves are great, they pop in your mouth, are juicy and full of flavor. I chose the deluxe chili dog which is basically a standard chili dog plus bacon, onion, jalapeños and a literal fistful of shredded cheese. I'm super picky about chili, can't stand it if it's soupy or greasy or overly spicy for no reason. I wasn't disappointed, everything about it was delicous. My hunny picked the Las Vegas chili dog, and I can honestly say, it was basically a flavor explosion on a bun.   My order was misread and delivered wrong at first, but the cook not only insisted on fixing it, did so in record time. The server was nothing but helpful, the overall service was great.  If the order had come out correctly the first time, this would be a solid five star review, as it is, I'd honestly say it's more of a 4.5 than a 4. If want a hotdog but wanna have it be better than pretty much anything you could make at home for a reasonable price, this is your place.   I can't even wait to try the sausage selection.

Reviews.Author: Vincent
Reviews.Content: This is one of those places that remind me of New York thank you for bringing this into town best hot dogs I've had in forever since I've been here in Las Vegas good job guys very friendly service the owner is awesome

Reviews.Author: Allison
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to this hot dog, and sorry Great Links, but it was pretty average....... nothing great here........ I guess they used to use Boars Head Hot Dogs, but they are no longer able to get them from their supplier. The hot dogs they get now are okay, but an all beef hot dog, not the beef and sausage blend like the Boars Head brand. I got the deluxe chili cheese hot dog and the deluxe chili cheese fries. The fry was the star of the show here, not the hot dog. Still, all in all the place is nice, the service is nice, just a little disappointed in the  Great Link  I was hoping for.

Reviews.Author: Jason David
Reviews.Content: I like their dogs,  best ones in town.   Customer service usually sucks though because the staff gets so bitchy.    Today my experience here was worse than in the past.   They had the basketball game so loud that it was hard to be heard by the cashier when ordering (TV is right above the ordering station for to go orders).   After waiting for several minutes to be acknowledged by the staff someone came to the register.   The order taking guy didn't look at me once during the order and I had the distinct feeling I was keeping him from his tables. I tried to order what I used to get (was called the Great Linkisi or some such) and instead of telling me  we don't make that anymore  the order taker simply denied all knowledge of the old flagship dog and didn't offer similar options even when asked.   He was not even willing to check with another staff member to see if they knew what it was (and a lot of these guys have worked here for a while).

Reviews.Author: E.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here today, on a Saturday. We've passed this place several times and always said we'd eat here. If it wasn't for the need to go to Lowes, we would have missed out on how great this place is!   It was around 2:30ish so we must have just missed the lunch crowd. As we were looking over the menu, I know I was constantly changing my mind of what I wanted. Then I saw the bratwurst and my mind was made up. Same for my husband. In fact, we decided to order two of the #3 (brat, drink, and fries). I ordered my brat with K-up, mustard, cheese, and onions (Yum!); the fries the crinklely ones and my husband ordered his with the spicy mustard only; the fries traditional.  We were not disappointed with our food at all. In fact, we both wanted another despite already been stuffed. A couple for the road maybe? As others have mentioned in their reviews, these dogs do have a  snap  to them when you take that first bite. It's the way a dog or a brat should be. All dogs and fries are made fresh when ordered, which you can tell. The refills on your drinks are free and automatically served in those take-out cups so you can fill up before heading out the door.   Even though we both got the brats, we will definitely go back (Lowes stop or not) and try their other dogs. The space is kind of small but I think it addes to the atmosphere and there's counter sitting as well. This restaurant also had a warm, friendly feeling to it. I also get the feeling it's family run which is great to see. We highly recommend Uncle Al's!

Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: Great food and service. Very friendly staff.   Great variety of food.  Bratwurst is fantastic!!!

Reviews.Author: Maya
Reviews.Content: Omg there so good and awsome I feel in love with this place service is awsome I got full with 1 hot dog good portions ..

Reviews.Author: Jez
Reviews.Content: I was taken here by my supervisor who has a habit of preferring not necessarily healthy venues but rather fast-foodish yet yummy treats which honestly left me a little apprehensive.  Our previous venture to Four Kegs was fun but left me eating salads for the remainder of the day.  What was I to expect here?  Well, the location was good - by a Starbucks I like and by Lowe's as well, so it had promise if it turned out to be a positive establishment.  Thankfully, it was.  The food was bar-style food done pretty well.  The service was pretty much kids who were on the ball.  On the four visits I've had, I've been pleased with the continual quality of service.  My drink was never low for long and my food arrived quickly and hot.    It's a simple menu and exactly what it promises: Burgers, fries, Italian sandwiches with a decent sauce, and offers a nice variety of french friends.  Their combo sauce of ketchup meets mayonnaise is pleasantly addicting and I enjoy the fact that they have a channel on the History Channel - thank you for not insulting the intelligence of your customers.    Cheap, yummy, good service.  Type you can bring your father to leaving little room for him to grumble.

Reviews.Author: Lara
Reviews.Content: Arrive at 7:00p, get greeted 10 minutes after and server apologizes for wait.... Said he will be back with us shortly 8 minutes pass and he finally gets out order. Made to order so it's fresh.  Hot dog and Philly cheesesteaks were pretty good.  Would come back and try again because customer service was so good.

Reviews.Author: corey
Reviews.Content: My mom was right. A true found gem. The care is as amazing as the food!! COME!! My new go to..

Reviews.Author: Joy
Reviews.Content: I was surprised their food is really good and their bun the BUN will just melt in your mouth OMG

Reviews.Author: CHRISTALYN
Reviews.Content: The second time eating here and both times less than satisfied. The first time I was so excited to have a childhood favorite Frito pie, but too my surprise the chili was sour like the meat was bad!!! Then the second time I thought just try something they are known for... Hot Links!!! But even that was gross!!!!!! The only reason why it gets two stars is because my child loves the Grilled chz sandwich even if she told the lady she wanted chips and got fries!! Oh well ...  Good luck!

Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: First time here, and I love it! The service is friendly, the atmosphere is fun, and the food is phenomenal! Had the Chicago dog and loved it! The menu is very varied, so I'll definitely be back to try more!

Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: My new home away from home!  Hot Dogs - one of my favorite foods, and Great Links hasn't let me down once!  What a menu!  So hard to decide what to order, but one thing I know for sure, their Cottage Fries (potato chips) ROCK!  Give them a try, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Louis
Reviews.Content: WOW. Get the Buffalo Fries and add the Vegas Chili, thank me later, as your life will now be changed forever. Your Welcome in advance.

Reviews.Author: Esther
Reviews.Content: This place is great! The food is amazing and the staff is always friendly! I go here regularly and will continue to do so. The only thing I would change is the size of the establishment. It's a tight fit when it's busy.

Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Vegas needs more places exactly like this! Not only do they make amazing assed hot dogs, they also have something called a pastrami cheeseburger (I CAN HAS?). Their menu is extensive and goes anywhere from a plain hot dog to full on Chicago dogs and Caesar salads.  For such a small place they had quite the selection of beers (by the bottle), too.      I went with the Chicago dog and was excited to see they use the bright green relish. I have never been to Chicago, but I feel even the most extreme purist would delight in this party in your mouth. The wiener (hehe) was crisp with every bite and the toppings were fresh! The service felt familiar and could be confused with anywhere but Vegas. I haven't even gotten to the best part... The Cottage fries. Made fresh with each order, they are fried to perfection and lightly seasoned with sea salt. No ketchup needed. I will go back just for these. I hear they are crowded on Sunday Mornings, next time I go I'll be sure to go for breakfast.

Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend were in the other side of town the other day and decided to try something different. The ambiance was pretty casual and everybody seemed really nice. I ordered a Bacon burger and a chili cheese dog, and my girlfriend just ordered a chili cheese dog.  The food was really mediocre considering it was $6.50 for a burger and $5 for a hot dog. If we were a couple of dollars cheaper I probably would have been okay with it.   The reason I'm giving it 3 stars because I cook behind the counter never changed his gloves and was wiping his face with sweat the whole time. Luckily the meal tasted good.   Not sure if I'm coming back due to the fact that the prices were pretty high for just a burger and hotdog. And if that guy keeps working here I will not be coming back because that place looks very unsanitary due to no changing of any gloves.

Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: Amazing $5 lunch. This is an little place tucked into a strip mall. The staff is very nice and the menu is big. I recommend the $5 Special, you get a hot dog, corn dog, fries, soda and either chicken nuggets or grilled cheese. What a deal and everything was really good. If this was closer to my house I would eat here all the time!

Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: I know this place keeps winning awards for it's burgers, and I keep meaning to try one, but I always end up getting a hot dog with my favorite toppings (bacon/cheese/grilled onions) because it is SO delicious.  They use good quality products & do little tricks like putting a lid on the finished dog so steam softens the bun & all the toppings melt together into gooey deliciousness.  Prices are reasonable and there is more variety on the menu then I will ever get around to trying.    Also the people could not be nicer - the owner/manager goes out of his way to make sure you are happy with the food - and how could you not be?  Best hot dog in Vegas Baby!  :)

Reviews.Author: Leah
Reviews.Content: These people are KILLING the hot dog and sausage game! Everything was on point! I dont eat red meats or pork and was so excited to see a vegetarian Selection! I ordered the chicken philly and was so pleased with how it tasted..considering its not  real  meat.  My boyfriend inhaled both his hotdogs  (beef) Chicago and NY street dog. Lisa was our server..great customer service and very attentive to her duties as well as the grill chef (we sat at the bar). The menu is filled with variety so there's something for everybody!  Prices are great to! Wonderful first impression..definitely will be a returning customer!

Reviews.Author: Ernie
Reviews.Content: Don't be confused their Italian beef taste like it came from nowhere close to Chicago's  real Italian beef. Your beef taste,like it came out of some cafe at,a casino bla

Reviews.Author: Tracy
Reviews.Content: I have to agree, Ashley is an amazing server. My mom and I had stopped in earlier in the week and it was my first visit. I had a Bratwurst and my mom had the Italian beef. I was very impressed, thought it was a cute small spot with good food.  Tonight my daughter and I came back for a fun dinner on a girls night... They were very busy and only a few tables inside empty (they also have outdoor seating and a nice diner style bar)  Ashley was our server and their were two cooks, I thought when we walked in we may be waiting a while. Boy was I wrong. We had our drinks in no time, placed our order and enjoyed the Razorback game on one TV and The Cubbies on the other.  Our food was hot and fresh. As soon as our food came out of the fryer it was at our table and oh it was Wonderful!! Fried mushrooms in their beer batter was just the way to start. You must try the cottage fries which are really homemade chips!!  Being from the Chicago land area, I know a good Chicago dog and this was over the top. My daughter had the fish and chips and absolutely loved it!  Ashley had her hands full with all her tables, but you would have never known. She made it look like a breeze and we never felt neglected! She has a great personality and seems like she really enjoys her job! Both the cooks were nice and doing an amazing job getting food out dast, fresh and yummy!! One of the cooks even brought my daughter over a cookie when we were getting ready to leave, which really made her night. On our way out ashley told her to have a good week at school!  On the way home she kept telling me how many of their other treats she was going to try next time.  Can't wait to bring the hubby and kids in next weekend!!

Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. Always doing a great job with customer service and great food. I would highly recommend. Many different variations of hot dogs. Sausage. Burgers. Fry's. This place is off the chain..

Reviews.Author: Chiefs Wife
Reviews.Content: Came here based on the reviews. Really good service, the Italian fries are bomb. The breaded mushrooms had a doughy taste perhaps taken out of the fryer al little too soon. The chili cheese dog was ok, I assumed the cheese would have been melted but it wasn't. This place is ok I guess

Reviews.Author: Latoya
Reviews.Content: I love how their hot dogs snap when you bite into them.  The hot links are equally delicious with the peppers, onions and mustard.  Oh...and the burgers are top notch too!  Don't miss the crinkle cut fries with hot sauce and gobs of melted cheddar cheese.  Lastly, you'll need a hand scooped shake to wash it all down.  This place is the true Heart Attack Grill.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the food and staff here!  I've tried their Reuben which is amazeballs!  Their cheesesteak is to die for and I love all of their options of sausages and hot dogs and they have an abundance of options for vegetarians which is a plus since my friend is vegetarian,  so for all you sandwich, hot dog, sausage,  and vegetarian lovers out there this is the go to spot....indulge and enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: I love this place! being a vegetarian i never have very many options wherever i go eat and great links has so many choices! i love it! great veggie dogs, veggie burgers, and vegetarian chilli cheese fries! soooo good!!!

Reviews.Author: Kayla
Reviews.Content: I've never lived in Chicago, but sometimes I sure miss Chicago Dogs. And though there are some places to get a reasonable interpretation of a Chicago Dog, none of them really hit it right in every single way...until now!  Uncle Al's uses their very own dogs and that's part of what makes this place so special. Their dogs  snap  when you bite in, just like a good Chicago dog should. (They have skinless for you wusses that don't understand the true nature of a good dog.)  Aside from Chicago, they have about another dozen styles of hot dogs -- all of them wrong except the Chicago. (Ketchup?? On a hot dog? Ew!) They also have a variety of other sandwiches and burgers, but if you have any sense in your head, you come here for the dogs.  Aside from the dogs, they have real french fries. They're kind of limp but for some reason, I still really like them. I've tried the coleslaw twice and regretted it twice. Stick to the dogs...and the limp fries.

Reviews.Author: Vagabundo
Reviews.Content: Chicago dog and cheese fries lived up to the Yelp recommendation.  Waitress was on top of her game and food was excellent. No reason to give it less than 5 stars

Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: I have eaten here many times.  The food is always fresh, hot & yummy.  Prices are pretty average.  You do get large portions too.  I recommend to anyone looking for some great gut bomb food.

Reviews.Author: Shokouh
Reviews.Content: I really wish I would have liked this place more, especially because I was super excited to finally try it. Actually, when I first walked in, I kind of fell in love. The atmosphere is relaxed and our server was super friendly, gave us time and answered any questions we had.   We ordered the Chicago and the Las Vegas hot dog with the natural Italian fries on the side. The fries came out first and unfortunately they were just ok. Too much parmesan cheese, too salty and too fatty and they got soggy very quick. The hot dogs were ok, almost too much of everything in my opinion.   Then, as soon as we walked out of this place, I ended up having an upset stomach that lasted all day. But this also could be due to me eating generally organic and healthy and perhaps my body doesn't like fatty food anymore. My husband was ok and he ate the same as I did, so I don't think the meat was bad. Regardless, I didn't like it enough to go back any time soon, but if I did, I think I would stay away from all the loaded hot dogs and try a simple one or get a sandwich.

Reviews.Author: Aljamin
Reviews.Content: There's no place like Great Links! There are very few places that you can go to here in Las Vegas where you actually feel like you're not in Las Vegas. And Great Links has the formula to make you feel like you're one of their own! The first time I had a Great Links signature hot dog, I tried the  Mob Boss  (pictured). I can't even come up with the words to describe how full of flavor (and calories) it is! Their hot dogs are tasty, the marinate sauce wasn't special, but was still good, the peppers are grilled, and the best part is the mozzarella sticks in it! YUM!  One of the treats that Great Links offers is their fresh raspberry iced tea! SO BOMB! it's taDAfor! The staff is really friendly and welcoming and the environment is really chill. If you go there, you'll see that this place has definitely made an impression on Yelp because of all the stickers all over the place. The time I came here was for a Laker game and the flat screens they have up sufficed for the entertainment and the cook (I forgot his name :x) is a HUGE Laker fan also! He made the dinner interesting with all the cheering and comments to the tv screen.  The setup of Great Links isn't like any other place here in Las Vegas and I'd have to say, aside from the great customer service, it would be the coolest part of this great Vegas spot! There aren't a lot of places set up this way so it makes it even more special! Their menu includes vegetarian dishes, beer brats cooked and marinated on the spot, a ton of different variances of their hot dog recipes! They also have sausages for the hot & spicy lovers out there. Their Italian fries are a basket OD garlic-y goodness! I highly recommend extra crisy shoestring fries! Perfect addition to any hot dog combination! I also tried their Vegas fries! This isn't for the light-hearted French fry lover; or even the heavy hearted (HIGH IN CALORIES, but good!) but if a friend orders them, grab a fork and grab a bite! Definitely worth a try!  I will have to come back to try the rest of their colorful palette of hot dogs and fries! Their great customer service bumps them up a star also! Go great with Great Links! :)

Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: the best junk food and fast service.  cheap prices.  i love this place.  i accidentally left this in caps,too lazy to correct.  come here and pig out!

Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: OMG! If you haven't been here it's a must try absolutely amazing food.  The staff is awesome. Every single thing I've had is amazing.  Wet Italian beef, different hot dogs, especially the one with marinara and mozzarella sticks omg to die for! Last time I ordered the beef and cheddar wow delicious! My boyfriend is from Chicago and we just love the food, beer and pleasant staff. Awesome place!!

Reviews.Author: Kent
Reviews.Content: My friend took me here to great links. I ordered the old west burger and sweet potato French fries. Both were excellent and delicious. My friend ordered the Italian beef sandwich and a New York hot dog. He said they were awesome. The Owner is very friendly and greets many of his customers including us.(like the Mayor)

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite places in Vegas. I'd eat here daily if I could. The fries are amazing, the bratwurst and Italian sausage is to die for! I always get mob boss style. Sooo good. I go here all the time when I'm in Vegas and thankfully I'm moving back soon. This place and Monta are my favorite places in the city.

Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: Yum, yum, yummy!  I'm in love with Great Links!  We finally made it over to Great Links this weekend and I am kicking myself for making it out here sooner!  I have wasted many, many years of AMAZING edible delights by not coming to Great Links earlier.  At least I have seen the light and the error of my ways!  We sampled the Streets of New York Dog (yum), the Ball Park Dog (classic), and a kraut dog (tasty), as well as the über-fantastic Italian tater tots.  The dogs were all amazing!  The have a great snap when you bite in to them, which is always a sign of a quality dog.  The toppings were all on point and in a decent amount for the dogs we ordered.  I think the kraut here is some of the best I have ever had.  EVER.    Now on to the the most fabulous tater tots I have ever had the pleasure of eating.  We tried the Italian tater tots on our server's recommendation.  We were going to do fries, but her told us the tater tots would stand up better to all of the sauce, so we went with it.  Oh my goodness, those things were tasty!  The garlic goodness was great and the Parmesan on top sent it over the moon.  We had them finished before I had finished my hot dog, so I used some of my bun to soak up the extra sauce and it was stay fantastic.  Yummmm!  I can't wait to go back and try more dogs, sausages, burgers, and everything else they had on the huge menu.  I see this place becoming a very regular place for my family.

Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: We just left there.  The staff was soso. The kid who waited on us was very friendly. But the guy with the ponytail... Well lets just say he ruined our experience.  We all ordered shakes (which were made fresh but too milky, not sure if there was ice cream in there at all) but I never got mine. When we asked for it he said i didnt order one. I was the one that ordered all of them.  We ordered cheese fries with shoestring potatoes and got soggy crinkle cut ones.   But on a good note the dogs are really tasty and so was the chicken sandwich.

Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: Tried the chili cheese fries .. really good. Staff is very quick and attentive. . Food is great. MUST TRY IF YOUR IN VEGAS

Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: Between the Chicago dog and the Italian sausage, this place is doing it right. Try the Italian fries, definitely delicious with the root beer. Beer battered fried mushrooms are also a hit for me. They have fast and friendly service even on the busiest of afternoons.

Reviews.Author: Irma
Reviews.Content: We love this place, we live in south LV but go to church on this side of town and this place a must! My favorite is the Philly Grilled and the Italian Fries (crinkle cut), also love the Ortega Chili Burger! My daughter's love the Buffalo Fries.... and the prices are beyond reasonable for what you get & service is great, they always remember you and are very attentive regardless of how busy this lil place gets.

Reviews.Author: Jasmine
Reviews.Content: My whole family and I love this place! You walk in sit whenever you'd like or you can make a Togo order. The staff is always friendly and accommodating. They have old 6 packs on the table that house their condiments and hold up their paper menus. This is a very laid back no frills place which is great when you just want to be casual. I always order the Chicago dog with a hot link and the clam strips with wasabi ranch so awesome! This is a family owned place so you will see pretty much the same faces everytime you come in. They have beer on draft and even RootBeer on draft! If you haven't been I suggest you go! Love this place!

Reviews.Author: Alyxandra
Reviews.Content: Love love love how they have vegetarian options for just about everything on the menu! Not to mention great tasting vegetarian options, to those familiar(or not) meat substitutes can be questionable. And the service and vibe in there has to be the reason we are always in there. They're so friendly and treat you like one of their friends or family!

Reviews.Author: Vickie
Reviews.Content: I love this place! It has become our go to weekend spot and the food never fails. Sundays can get pretty crazy and busy but the food is always consistent. I have never ordered anything that I haven't liked. Great food at great prices!

Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: I had heard of this place a long time ago and forgot about it by the time I moved to the area.  I saw it recently while driving around and thought  gee, I gotta get me some of that.   So come Saturday I was really craving a hot dog and off I went to be wrapped up in the menu like a hot dog in a bun.  It is a big menu for such a small place.  There are many different varieties of hot dogs as one might expect from a place called Great Links Hot Dogs.  But there is so much more.  There are also many types of sausage sandwiches to choose from as well.  Did I forget to mention they are famous for their burgers.  Yeah, they have won the Burger Wars burger competition two years running.  Then there are the many diffferent fried potato variations and combinations too.  Onion rings, jalapeno poppers, fried mushrooms.  The menu goes on and on.  I was so fascinated in all the offerings they have that I forgot all about my hot dog craving and went with a sausage sandwich instead.  It was a toss up between the Roasted Garlic and Mozzarela or the Spinach and Asiago Cheese.  The Spinach and Asiago is topped with mustard, mayo, tomato, pickles, relish and sport peppers not unlike a Chicago style hot dog.  It sounded damn good as a Chicago style dog is my favorite.  In the end it was the Roasted Garlic and Mushroom sausage that won my stomach and my heart.  A perfectly grilled chicken sausage stuffed with cheese and mushrooms then topped with grilled onion, bell peppers and mushrooms with the addition on marinara on top of that.  I also got an order of the stuffed jalapenos.  There were six in a basket and were served piping hot fresh out of the fryer.  The crisp coating was not oily despite being fried for about 4 minutes.  The molten cream cheese inside was nearly too much for my mouth to handle but the cooling richness of the ranch dip helped everything slide down.  Add a 22 ounce Amber Bock beer and Saturday is now the happiest day of the week.

Reviews.Author: Kira
Reviews.Content: I just had the most amazing grilled cheese sandwhich here! I was craving an egg sandwhich so the staff were very kind to let me add a fried egg to my grilled cheese with tomato on Rye. They don't usually serve breakfast on weekdays, but they let me special order since they were not busy. It is not everyday that you find a place that is a hole in the wall greasy spoon with good home cooked food!! Seriously, best grilled cheese/egg sandwhich I have ever had. They also have amazing fries and rootbeer floats!!

Reviews.Author: Karl
Reviews.Content: Great place and great Hot Dogs and Sausages. We stopped in and I had the Chicago and Wifey had the Garlic Sausage with Chili/Cheese. Both were fantastic. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Author: Danny
Reviews.Content: Great hot dogs and burgers I love the Chicago dog. Its easier to do take out instead of eating there. The restaurant is small and the day I went only had one waitress to service every one. The waitress was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Author: Cresencio
Reviews.Content: How can you say no to this masterpiece  OLD WEST BURGER ?? This was delicious! I highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Author: Krystle
Reviews.Content: Went to this place after reading some reviews on yelp and I definitely wasn't disappointed! I got onion rings and the las vegas chili dog..soo amazing! I would go to this place again :)

Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: Just a small time diner with easygoing staff and atmosphere. You had a long day or just want some quick comfort food? This is a good spot. Effort is made 100% by them to provide great service.  Food is fried and very diner like so don't go in thinking this is a strip/fancy style restaurant with delacacies that will blow your mind! It's a place you can relax, get a beer, have a good dog or burger and watch the game in peace and good company. A little confusion with orders getting mixed from cooks but I can tell it's a new crew and they are gonna give it their all to get it together and be a smooth operating spot. Will def come again! Oh and try the fry sauce. It's bomb!

Reviews.Author: Rheo
Reviews.Content: i ordered the chicken Caesar salad sandwich when i went and it was stellar. i will be back again and again !!! they have such a huge selection of stuff i don't know how anyone wouldn't be able to find something delicious on the menu!

Reviews.Author: Diva
Reviews.Content: Eh.  I read the reviews here and thought to give it a try since my husband loves hot dogs.  We ordered the cheese fries, Atlanta Slaw dog, San Antonio Dog and the Strawberry milkshake.  The milkshake was DE-LISH!  The cheese fries were a definite no - they used liquid cheese instead of the cheedar cheese and melting it onto the fries, so the fries were bland in flavor.  My husband had the hot dogs, and he said they didn't have much flavor.  He said the hot dog should have a better flavor, and anything additional should just make it taste that much better.  Our waiter never came by  to check if everything was ok, it was when we were paying for our check did another waiter asked how our experience was.

Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: Terrific take on classic fare! We each had the Great Linski Kielbasa and WOW, what a great choice!  It seems unlikely you could go wrong here and you DO want to hurry in...it's just a great choice for a solid meal that is interesting, satisfying and very generous in its size.

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: My brother came to visit from LA and he always uses Yelp... So he found this place and said there was good reviews and we would try it... We went and LOVED IT!! I have been back many times since. I just don't recommend going when they first open.

Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: Amazing. The crinkle fries are great and the hot dogs. Mozzarella sticks or cheese sticks are better than most.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: This place was very good.  I had the Las Vegas Dog.  The White sage chili that they mounded on the hot dog was most excellent.  I would have preferred my tomatoes diced instead of wedged, but that is a personal preference. The blending of the mustard and mayo was excellent as well. The service was ok.  When the staff was at our table it was very polite and pleasant.  However, they seemed to have a serve by team approach and we were inconsistent in getting service to our table.  Food was great.

Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Awesome little place for some great food! My son and I love it!

Reviews.Author: Nelson
Reviews.Content: What better way to kick off the New Year by reviewing another local business!? Also, since Yelp only allows you to rate 1-5stars and nothing in between, I've come up with a  Shaka-Meter  where it allows 0-10 Shakas ..\uuu/...and everything in between!  So we were in the area and have always passed Great Links, but this time, we stopped in for a bite. Locally owned and run, staff makes you feel at home. We split the Vegas Chili Dog and I got the Pastrami Cheeseburger. Wifey got a Bacon Cheeseburger and  we both got some delicious Death Valley Root Beer on tap! Woooohooo!!!  The burgers were okay, just too well done for my taste, but the star was the Vegas Chili Dog. I love the snap you get from each bite! We plan to return, but unless they cook burgers to a desired temperature, I'll just go down the hot dog side of the menu, or maybe even choose from the wide variety of menu items they have.   ALOHA!!!  Shaka-Meter: \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uu   3.5  YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(1/365)  Wassup Dog!?!?

Reviews.Author: Cathy
Reviews.Content: I feel so silly to think I've already done a review for Great Links! I've been here so many times since they opened...I was going to update my review but it turns out, there was nothing to update! FAIL!  They have good hotdogs here. They're fresh and you could hear the snap when you bite into one. I personally like to keep it simple and get the chili dog. Very flavorful and I don't like beans so this is perfect for me. The cheese is nice and melted. But I've also tried their Mob Boss Dog which has mozzarella sticks, peppers, onions, marinara, mushrooms and parmesan cheese.  It's a great hotdog when I'm not feeling so plain.  The main reason I like this place is their Italian fries. One of my favorite fries in Vegas. Each fry is loaded with Parmesan and Italian spices. I don't like sharing mine so get your own!  I remember John Curtas raving about their burgers but I still haven't deviated from their hotdogs.  One of these days, I'll give their burger a try...with a side of Italian fries of course!

Reviews.Author: Alan
Reviews.Content: Raise the prices and they lower the quality. They now no longer use Boars Head products. Their current products worse I ever tasted. Service was always slow and that day was no exception. With tip it cost $30 for two people for hot dogs,fries, and drinks. My advice stay at home and eat Oscar Meyer it will taste better.

Reviews.Author: J.S.
Reviews.Content: Lots of options on the menu and all cooked to order but nothing much available beyond hot dogs and burgers so go elsewhere if you're not feeling like that type of food. Service was eh. I had to order my drink 2x before receiving it. They were able to split our check for us- which is super convenient.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband love the burgers here and we love that we can have tots instead of fries. Big juicy and flavorful. The fry sauce is a great bonus! Excellent service provided by Ashley, thanks Ashley for taking good care of us. We recommend trying. We will be back!

Reviews.Author: Loren
Reviews.Content: Now Great Links is not a place I think most people should visit more than a few times a year. Yes, the menu items are very tempting and on days when you are craving calorie adding and artery clogging foods, this is the place to go.  I was excited to see they offer veggie options and that is what I ordered: vegetarian chili and vegetarian hot dog plus a side salad. Most other items are fried, covered in cheese and sauces. I see this place as somewhere to stop by to watch the game, have a beer and eat some fried foods.  The open kitchen with the bar next to it is very inviting to chat with the employees. There aren't very many seats other than that so maybe getting items to go is another option. The restaurant could use a deep cleaning on the floors and such- it felt a bit grimy to me.  Also, I saw an employee serve himself a fountain drink and drink it in the kitchen. Later the same employee scratched his head/neck while behind the counter next to the stove.  I don't know, the heavy greasy foods and the lack of cleanliness of the place are enough for me to pass on this as a choice next time I am in the area.

Reviews.Author: Taelor
Reviews.Content: I am beyond impressed with ashley the server. I couldnt imagine better service and i dont let things like that go unnoticed. I would come back here just to see her. The food is just to die for and her helping us just made everything 5 stars. Well deserved, she definitely deserves a raise for the impeccable job she does! Kept us laughing and happy to be there! Keep her around! We will be back!!!!   Thank you!! Very appreciated!

Reviews.Author: Marianne
Reviews.Content: Good food, small place. They have a nice selection of dogs, sausages, and burgers as well as multiple versions of French fries. I enjoyed my beer brat served mob boss style, which included mushrooms, grilled onions and peppers, marinara sauce, and two mozzarella sucks. The Italian fries were okay - heavy on the Parmesan cheese, light on the garlic butter sauce and Italian seasonings. I had a taste of my boyfriends Italian beef sandwich and it was the best of the bunch with a decent portion of beef, grilled peppers, and a nicely flavored au jus for dipping. Definitely worth going back!

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Love this place!! Since I lived the first 24 years of my life in the Mid-West (Detroit area)  I really miss this type of food/restaurants.  This place is great.  Thankfully its across town from me so I don't get there often or I'd have to buy a Radio Flyer wagon to carry my fat a$$ around!

Reviews.Author: Mrs. Rip
Reviews.Content: Moved from NJ and missed our hot dog joint.  Someone recommended Great Links and it's awesome.  Walk in and sit where ever you like.  No fuss, no muss.  Super casual, laid back atmosphere.  It's a hot dog joint!  Big menu, great chili hot dogs, root beer on tap, beer on tap, SUPER friendly staff.  To go food too.  Like the counter seats - you can watch the cooks :)   Non smoking - no gambling - thankful for that, (no tourists) lots of parking.  Look forward to trying the sausage next time.  We will be back!  UPDATE:  was there tonight 1/1/15 and had the sausage,peppers,onions. Hot sausage! It was awesome. Only bummer, serving size is super small. One link on a hotdog size bun. Back in NJ this would be on a big roll with about 3 links and tons of peppers and onions. True hoagie style. So order two or three if you're hungry!  But def try it. It's delish.

Reviews.Author: Francine
Reviews.Content: OMG...Something for everyone and it is all wonderful.  This is ONE place you must try (and then you will be hooked) Meat or Veggie,,,, they got it for you

Reviews.Author: Lalo
Reviews.Content: Hands down the fries are amazing. We order  The Deluxe Fries . The atmosphere is great. However I ordered a  cheese chili dog  and it was just average. And we also ordered  the streets of New York  and it was great. I will be going back again for sure.

Reviews.Author: A
Reviews.Content: It was my 2nd trip here.  The first time I had the roasted galic & mozzarella chicken sausage with a side of chili cheese tater tots.  This time I went for the Habanero chicken sausage and the Bratwurst.  Of all I tasted I must say the Habanero! a little bit of heat, but very flavorful.    The service is great. both the chef and waitress always come by and check if everything is ok or if I need anything.

Reviews.Author: Candy
Reviews.Content: Love the food here!! My favorite locals stop. I would be remiss if I didn't mention our server Michelle, she is a HUGE reason why we come back time after time. Her friendly attitude and her  make you feel like home  ways truly make the dining experience.  You're lucky to have such a great employee who seems to love what she does and her guests!!

Reviews.Author: Casey
Reviews.Content: The chili fries and burger we got were very good, prices were good as well. However, my review is mainly for the service. The young lady that waited on us was very friendly, efficient, and overall did an excellent job. I watched her handle one rude group of people after another without batting an eye. I don't know when it became acceptable to treat other people this way, but this young lady certainly didn't let it bother her!  It's unfortunate that people are jerks but she did an AMAZING job!

Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: Best dogs and burgers in vegas! Their jalapeño guacamole cheeseburger kicks butt! Try the french fry variations and fried pickles! You will not want to go anywhere else! Fox five burger war champs 3 years running for good reason! Mil. Discounts also.

Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: Burgers here were great! And so were the chili cheese fries. It says draft house, yet don't actually have any beers on draft. However, do have a pretty decent selection of beer, considering the dive type burger/hot dog shop.  Either way I highly recommend this spot for a great bite to eat!

Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: The food is worth 4 stars, service is worth 2.   I've been a couple of times recently and they are consistently understaffed...which leads to long wait times to place or pick up a to-go order, and slow service when you dine in. Their main waitress seems too busy and stressed, and the owner really needs to bring on another person during the lunch rush or else risk losing business.   As for the food- the Italian fries are so good! Make sure to get them with the skinny fries (the crinkle fries are too fat and never really seem crispy), and their fry sauce. My husband loved his Las Vegas Chili Dog, and they do a great Chicago Dog. If they give their staff some help and bring on another server we'd be back more often.

Reviews.Author: Miz Marilyn
Reviews.Content: My man likes the burgers and dogs here. I am not 100% sold. I ordered the Italian Beef and if you are from Chicago, or have enjoyed a really decent beef sandwich in Chicago, This beef sandwich was a huge disappointment. So next time I will stick with a burger or dog.

Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: This place rocks.  Come for the fresh cut fries and stay for the pastrami topped cheese burger. . Everyone left full and happy.   Don't forget to try the Italian fries.  That garlic butter is dangerously good.

Reviews.Author: Danielle
Reviews.Content: Every time my boyfriend and I eat here they remember us! It feels like home and always has delicious food! Can't ask for more:)

Reviews.Author: Travis
Reviews.Content: I've had the pleasure of eating here on just a few occasions and although I have a very limited diet they always know how to spice up my regular routine. Fantastic food and service was pretty good. Will surely come again and again..

Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: Great food and good beer.   We had the Cajun sausage dog and it was very tastey! It had shrimp on the hot dog that were cooked perfectly.  Me and the family will be returning, but could only give 4 stars as the prices arent too crazy but they are somewhat high for hotdogs.

Reviews.Author: Dhyanne
Reviews.Content: Decided while I was on that side of town to try this place, since I noticed they had won on Burger Wars on FOX NEWS. I am sure glad I did! The food was AMAZING! Service was Great! It was worth the trip out there (even though I was all ready on this side) My Burger was the best! I'll be back! Thank You for such a great Experience and I can see why you have won three years running!

Reviews.Author: Elyyse
Reviews.Content: Came here tonight w my husband. I couldn't eat anything there because of how disgusted I was with some serious hygiene concerns:  1. Started off with a dirty chair - crumbs and drips of liquid- no big deal, I understand. I asked the waitress wipe it down which she happily did, yet for the fact she only wiped down half if the chair..... Oh well I am hungry, I will sit in the still wet chair with unknown liquid....  2. Saw the cook with his gloves on wipe his nose with his gloves. Like a strong finger length swipe of the nostril.  He didn't change his gloves after that. His gloves were also clearly moistened so you can tell that his hands were sweating under the gloves which makes me wonder, how long have those gloves been on?   3. Next a different cook comes out into the dining room with gloves on again- gets himself a drink of water. I can clearly can see water drips through them. He then takes a napkin to his nose and wipes- does not change gloves. Then this guy tries to take our order, same gloves - pointing at the menu what are the featured items, giving me a closer view of the gloves to confirm, yes your hands are sweating bullets under these gloves which appear to have been on for at least 3 hours...  This guy was really nice and the food sounded awesome but the more and more I had to witness this weird Glove phenomenon.... I couldn't even order. Who wears gloves in the dining room of a restaurant????  My husband got his food to go, but I am pregnant and after viewing everyone w gloves on and wiping noses, getting personal drinks, taking orders, even flipping through a magazine, and then apparently not changing gloves - too much for me to risk a food borne illness or any other germ.  Really sucks the menu looked great too. Everyone was nice, it was just so awkward and the most disturbing thing is that these folks seemed to act like it was no big deal to not change gloves, which makes me wonder goes on behind the scenes in terms of cleanliness.  Sorry for the negative review but just had to share this and hopefully management will use this to improve.

Reviews.Author: Regina
Reviews.Content: It has been a while since I was here but didn't get around to writing a review until now.  I found it a bit off putting that the server had a thong string hanging out but I didn't want to be a prude.  The wait to be served was crazy long.  When I finally placed my order she never brought my drink and I had to go up to the bar and ask for it.  At the end of our meal I saw the guy behind the bar giving himself a shot of whip cream out of a can - then using the same can to finish someone's shake.  Gross.  That has to be a health violation!  And by the way- the food was forgettable.

Reviews.Author: Aimee
Reviews.Content: This was a fun find! Excellent food and yummy fries.  A little small (space-wise), but the food more than made up for it. The service was attentive and they kept our cups full! A definite repeater.

Reviews.Author: Kyla
Reviews.Content: I can't even begin to explain how awesome this place is, a colleague recommended it and it's amazing, I definitely don't go often enough, their food is awesome and all the employees are really cool!

Reviews.Author: Yvonne
Reviews.Content: Thumbs up! Great service, great food and very reasonably priced! Definitely worth the drive!

Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: Veggies beware. So grateful that this place has veggie/vegan items (and usually delicious), but the two times I've taken food to go there was meat in place of the ordered veggie dog (hidden beneath veggie bacon). It's really disturbing when you're vegan. If you're vegan/vegetarian, go and enjoy this place, but double check everything and don't take to go.

Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: Simply less than mediocre.  If your thinking about going, do yourself a favor and don't.  You don't have to be a 5 star chef to put some semi creative toppings on a freaking hot dog.  The only reason I didn't leave pissed off as apposed to mildly disappointed was because the prices were cheap.  Maybe it was my fault for expecting so much for such a low price, I should have remembered the age old saying, you get what you pay for .  But seriously people if you are craving a good hot dog either go to Pinks, or go to the store buy $10 worth of ingredients and get down with some good eats at home.  The End!

Reviews.Author: Eman
Reviews.Content: 5 stars off the bat!  Wanna know why?  Because the food is great and the service is greater!  I ordered the Mob Boss, and I shared the Vegas Chili Cheese Fries with my gf.  The Mob Boss had grilled onions, mushrooms, bell peppers, with marinara sauce and 2 mozzarella sticks on top with parmesan cheese to top it off, and of course the dog, it snapped every single bite I took. Fresh natural casing! Mmm!  And the Vegas Chili Cheese Fries were unique, it wasn't your average ground beef, onions, and beans chili, it tasted like broken down Italian sausage in it.  I didn't need ketchup or any other condiments with it because everything was THAT good!  The dine-in setting was a little small, but I had no problem with it, they had sports playing on the TV's and they also have bar seating!  Servers were cool and they made sure everything was OK with us.  I'm glad I finally tried this place out after driving by it how many times now.  I'm definitely gonna be a regular here knowing it's close to my house! ;)

Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: Service= top notch Food= super Price= excellent My husband and I live very close to Great Links and often stop in for a quick dinner when we are busy.  The little eatery is located in the Lowes parking lot so we often eat here midway through some home improvement project. The wait staff is so friendly and helpful, offering suggestions when asked. The food is delicious.  We love their cottage fries and I always ask for them extra crisp. My husband prefers his a little underdone and the cook always obliges both of us.  We mostly go for the dogs, which are loaded with different toppings per your selection.  My husband loves the  Las Vegas Chili Dog which is loaded with chili.  I am a Chicago dog fan and almost always go for the Chicago style dog.  Last night I opted for an Oretga chili bacon burger and was not disappointed. the burger had a lot of bacon on it.  Typically when I am out and order a bacon burger it comes a slice or maybe two of thin cut bacon.  Great Links' burger had a bacon weave if you will covering the top of my burger.   My daughter ordered chicken fingers and they were perfectly fried- crispy outside, juicy inside. The staff is so friendly and they are proud of what they have to offer.  We enjoy the home town feeling of the place All in all we love it.  We can grab dinner locally and go home full, all for under 20 dollars.

Reviews.Author: Frederick
Reviews.Content: The wife and I had a taste for a good dog. We decided on Great Links. I've never eaten there but the wife has used their takeout. I love a good dog and I wasn't disappointed. The wife had the  Louisiana Hot Link and I had my favorite the Chicago Dog. It was an excellent choice. Both were delicious. I was blown away that the fries stayed hot for the whole meal. Service was great. The young lady was on top of her game. I plan on eating there a lot. I will not go to another place for my Hot Dogs.

Reviews.Author: Tae
Reviews.Content: We love having breakfast here. Great food. Good people. If you're looking for a burger/dog joint. This is it. They allow you to make whatever your heart desires. Everything is a la carte, which is fine, you can mix and match. Prices are great for the quality of food.  Owner is a very humble guy. Unless you asked, you would not know that he is who he is.

Reviews.Author: Erica
Reviews.Content: No bueno... The food here was very bland to me. When i think of great links I think spicy savory tasty and i didn't get any of that from this experience. This is not a place i will be back to since the food just didn't do it for me.   The staff was nice but not enough to get them a higher rating since the food was so blah to me. Oh well

Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I've been going to great links for about 2 yrs always awesome great burgers and dogs , only reason didn't get 5 stars is one of the staff  raven  yes he says that's his name has been rude and condescending every time . Owner won't reply to calls or emails so I have scaled back going there everything else is highly recommended. On the other end of the scale michelle who works there has been awesome every visit since dat one ...

Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: This rating is for breakfast. My advice is, go anywhere else besides great links for breakfast. Our food. Took a long time, the  lightly seasoned hash browns  had so much seasoning on them to where they didn't even taste like potatoes and they were smashed flat and they were greasy. We ordered the eggs scrambled soft and they came scrambled hard. The ham steak was generic and quite salty. Toast is a side order  ?? We also had burgers there on another occasion and the burgers were decent but their prices are too high for the product delivered. We will not be going back. Ever.

Reviews.Author: Earl
Reviews.Content: Their dogs have that snap when you bite into them and have a nice spice to it.   Try their coleslaw dog, the spiciness of their dog + the cooling taste of slaw + the 100+ degree Vegas dry heat = nirvana  I'm craving their Chicago dog right now.

Reviews.Author: Teresa
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing.  When the kids and adults enjoy it, it's a win win.  Staff gave kids paper and crayons to play with before food came.  When food came the kids ate it and loved it!  My husband and I enjoyed our hotdogs, fried mushrooms, master grill fries, and fresh brewed root beers.  The staff even gave the kids their own pack of Oreo cookies free.  Whenever I'm in need of a hotdog this is the place I will be coming.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Great Chicago dog and chili cheese dog. Staff is very friendly. A cool place that we look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Author: Juan
Reviews.Content: Great service, friendly staff and great food. The chili cheese fries and chili dog and the best I've had since moving here to vegas. Though I'm at the other side of town now I still make it a point to get my usual whenever I get the chance.

Reviews.Author: Junsu
Reviews.Content: I never knew Boar's Head made sausages, too! Whenever I saw Boar's Head advertisements back in California, I knew the establishment served quality deli meat.  Back home, I've always yearned for a delicious dog joint akin to something like Top Dog in Berkeley. I even went so far as to consider opening one myself just so I could satiate my suffering for sausage; alas, I have found the hot dog heaven I've been looking for. I've been to this place four times in two weeks. Just straight incredibly delish dogs, fresh off the grill. Apparently their hamburgers are quite lauded, so once I go through the hot dog menu, I have another beautiful world to sink my teeth into.  The chili slaw dog and hot link have been my go to with a pint of Schrecher Draft Root Beer. I can't think of how this place can be any better.

Reviews.Author: Cee
Reviews.Content: Yum yum yum yummy yum! Finally a place where vegetarians can feel like home. For each menu selection, you have the ability to get a veggie version. Hot dogs, burgers, sausage, bacon...they carry soy based selections for everything! Friendly waitress, laid back atmosphere and most meals under $8!

Reviews.Author: Tiffanie
Reviews.Content: Ooohh I love their burgers here--Specifically I've tried the Ortega Bacon Pepper jack Burger and Jalapeno Guacamole Burger. They have never disappointed me.   Try them all. Actually really anything here is good.--next time I'll go for the hot dogs

Reviews.Author: Yas
Reviews.Content: Love it! their chili cheese hot dog is delicious and their prices are very reasonable. The kids menu offers good variety and it even comes with oreo cookies for the little ones.

Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in the service within moments of walking in the door. However, I was still excited to try the food.   There were three guys preparing the food, and one woman who ran the register as well as the entire floor. She greeted us by asking if our order was for there or to go. Since we said 'to go', she said that she would help us in a moment. She then proceeded to take an order at one table, ring up another table, and check on one more table before returning to take our order.  Okay, this was fine. Sort of. What ruined the visit for me was how she chewed her gum, open-mouth and all, while took our order. She didn't look at us, and didn't say anything when she presented us with our receipt to sign. No enthusiasm or care for anything, especially our business. That makes me angry.   We both got the 'Chicago Dog'. Since the dogs are made with Boar's Head meat, they did have pretty good flavor. However, maybe we should have chosen something other than a Chicago dog, as nothing compares to the real thing.   Would I go back again?...possibly. Chicago Dog?...nope. To-go?...yes, if I called my order in ahead of time.

Reviews.Author: Veronika
Reviews.Content: Kielbasa,  Italian sausage,  Chicago dog, all vegetarian sausage links, cheese burgers,  chilli dog,  chilli fries,  vegetarian chilli,  Italian fries...... I died and went to sausage and chili heaven.    This place is small,  family owned and run.  They are so friendly.  They make great suggestions and they have beer on tap and bottled.

Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: I'm big on first impressions and I was over impressed! Their dogs and links are amazing. An to top it off we accidently left a retainer there it was on a napkin and they had it already put up before I called them!! Great customer service I will definetly become a regular here!

Reviews.Author: Alisha
Reviews.Content: Holy smokes the dog I got was delicious! Think it's called the 9th island luau special. It was topped w/ BBQ pulled pork, mozzarella, potato hash, and a mango salsa! Service was friendly (I just ordered to go but I was greeted quickly, order taken and food made quickly to order). Best hot dog I've had. They've got about 20+ choices, plus a bar, and other sandwiches/ drinks/ sides, even soup and salads. I'll definitely be back to try other things. Awesome little neighborhood spot, next to my favorite nail place and Starbucks. What else do u need lol?!

Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: I've driven by this place for years & recently saw the reviews & went for it.  Yes it is a small place & it  can fill up quick so luckily I called in my order which was ready within 10 min. Portion sizes were great  for the  prices paid.  The food was definitely better than I expected. I didn't expect much from the mob boss hot dog because the marinara threw me off, but I think that's what made it taste great! The  chili cheese fries & mozzarella sticks aren't salty like other places either so that was  definitely a  plus. I  love mozzarella  sticks but it  sucks when  they're  so salty.  My daughter had the chicken bruschetta sandwich & she loved it! Mind you she doesn't eat bread,cheese, or any vegetable unless you bid them all somehow. My son had a meatball sandwich & loved it as well.   The staff was very friendly when we walked in. The lady who took my order was very patient when my phone was acting out when I called to place my order. Also they are very business friendly as well, several business cards are laid out on the counter & I was able to put my husband's business cards out as well. A lot of other restaurants won't let you do that unless you have some type of friendship/relationship with the owner.   This was our first time here & it won't definitely be our last! =)

Reviews.Author: Marc
Reviews.Content: First, if you're staying in a strip hotel, Great Links is a pretty good ride depending on traffic (which was deadly today!)...But, worth it.   I visited Great Links this afternoon.  Excellent.  Great diner atmosphere, exceptionally friendly and quick service along with tasty food.    I sampled the Mob Boss dog and the Original hot dog.  WOW!    First I tried the original hot dog.  It was a traditional natural casing dog with onions, relish, mustard and catsup.  Great taste, good snap to the dog and nice flavor.  Then, I manned up and tried the Mob Boss which  has grilled onions, peppers, mushrooms, cheese sticks, and marina sauce.  Great flavor, good snap to the dog and enormous.  Truly, a meal on a bun.  Stop in here while you're visiting Vegas.  It is worth the trip off the strip.

Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: So we decided to give this place a try knowing that it has some previous complaints on service.....well same old story and same old song and dance.  Very poor service, Greasy Fries and a tit-for-tat brouhaha between the server and the cook resulted in a 1.5 Hour wait and no food to boot. Lame service and the cook and server need to go. The owner came out and tried to apologize but the damage has been done. He should have offer a free meal for the 4 of us but he didn't go that extra mile so I'm posting what I think of this place.  What restaurant serves the side (fries and ring) before the Burger come out? That was our first clue Sherlock, and then the marathon wait begins.......................Nothing! So we left and went to Farmers Boys and got our meal in a reasonable time, Really FB beat you losers out?  greasy fries and very slow service. never again.......

Reviews.Author: Kendall
Reviews.Content: So everything I've ate here has been well cooked, seasoned, and delicious! That goes for cheeseburgers, Philly cheesesteaks, chili cheese fries, fried zucchini, mozzarella sticks, etc. I love the fact I can get an ice cold beer also.
