My only complaint is sometimes it takes a little long but in the end it's worth the wait. My aunt and uncle love the place so much they had a private party there for their anniversary. Hahaha! Keep it up Great Links and my belt will get tighter.

Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: Staff: very busy but nice.  Food: - I ordered the Ball Field Dog and French fries, The buns were very soggy, the dog was very hard and tasted weird. The fries were greasy....  - My friend ordered a veggie dog, it was very dry....  I got sick couple hours later ( I have a sensitive stomach though...)  Not my type of hot dogs...never again.  I think even weinersnitchel tastes better...  Yelpers, I don't understand the 4 stars...  As I said, the staff was busy but polite....

Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: great place. Hot line, bar & tables. Smells great inside. Different types of beers offered, some on tap. Root beer on tap, big menu, vegan & gluten free friendly if that's your thing. Food tastes great. Seriously, if you have a problem with this place - you have problems.

Reviews.Author: Tif
Reviews.Content: We just ate here and can tell it's going to be one of our favorite places! The staff were super friendly and te atmosphere was relaxed. I had a Philly dog and my husband had a jersey hot sausage with onions. These had to be the best we have ever had!

Reviews.Author: Narissa
Reviews.Content: Love this Place! The Quality of the Food and prices are awesome! Love the Chicago all beef hot dog and the burgers are amazing compared to prices at Five Guys.

Reviews.Author: Cathy
Reviews.Content: The service was very friendly and efficient.  My party of three had the Italian fries (excellent), chicken noodle soup (good), tuna sandwich (good), beer brat with sauerkraut and spicy mustard (OMG wonderful!), and the classic hot dog with relish, onions, mustard, and ketchup. Awesome joint, and I will DEFINITELY return!

Reviews.Author: Christian
Reviews.Content: How does this place survive you walk in wait 15 minutes for a drink after they said they will be with you 10 minutes ago especially when it's slow. Their food is great but it's always a wait. After going their for longer than a year I probably won't return.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Great food and friendly staff.  I have never had a bad experience yet in 6 visits.  Highly recommend brats and Philly cheesesteaks but everything is good.

Reviews.Author: Derek
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing! Service was great and the food even better !! It was our first time but it is our new favorite. It has the small intimate family owned feel and the meat is top quality. The food combined with the great service left us very impressed

Reviews.Author: jim
Reviews.Content: will wait to go a few times before bumping to 5 stars....but first time was awesome!  had to get the LV chili dog...delicious. that sage chili rocks. and the dill relish compliments it ridiculously well. dog itself was good, too. paired it w/ some cottage fries w/ cayenne sour cream to dip in and a big cold sprecher root beer, on tap no less.  place has a great looking menu (good selection of creative dogs, sausages, burgers and sammiches), nice selection of sides (fried pickles and green beans!) and a surprisingly decent beer selection (for a hot dog and burger grill). plus malts, shakes, etc.  and....they have vegetarian options. my girl is vegetarian....want to take her here so she can try a beer brat! (kinda curious about how a veggie brat tastes myself....)

Reviews.Author: Geneva
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. My boyfriend and I are both vegan and saw this place come up on HappyCow. They have veggie meats that can be substituted (at no additional cost) on any of their menu items. The only veg options that aren't vegan is the veg bacon and veg hot dog. Great place to eat if you want to venture of the strip!   Vegetarian selections: Veggie hot dog Veggie Italian sausage Veggie beer brat Veggie kielbasa  Veggie chicken patty Veggie burger patty Veggie bacon Veggie chili

Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: Great Links is a haven for vegetarian junk food lovers in the Northwest side of town.  Let me tell you what they offer for vegetarians:  vegetarian hot dogs, vegetarian chicken,  vegetarian Italian sausage,  vegetarian kielbasa,  vegetarian beer brats,  vegetarian bacon,  & vegetarian chili!!!   This means that, as a vegetarian, you can order a hot dog topped with strips of bacon and a pile of chili. Yes, it's possible. I did it. And I think it was only $4.   I love this place. It can get really busy, but it's affordable and the servers are always nice.

Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: Thanks Great Links Crew!   Very busy today.....wet damp day in the Valley. Everyone wanted hot dogs and burgers at Great Links. Food was great! Service was awesome. Just had to wait.....No big deal it was worth it! Will be back with my boys soon!

Reviews.Author: Neta
Reviews.Content: We were in the area and after doing some research on yelp. We made our way here (because Red Robin wasn't open yet). I had the grilled chicken mushroom sandwich $6.99 and an order of small crinkle cut fries $1.99. The sandwich was a little salty. Fries were golden and crispy. BF order 1/2 burger $6.99 and regular fries $2.99. The food was alright.

Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I'd NEVER been to a place specialising in hot dogs and wouldn't even think to order a hamburger! My sister saw them win Burger Wars and insisted we try their food. I live in the area and easily ordered my dinner on the phone after reviewing their menu online. I showed up 10 minutes later and was given a free small beverage. Because of the weight, I assumed I'd be dealing with a mess when I got home and amazingly enough everything was wrapped perfectly! We ordered the Ortega Bacon Pepper Jack Burger, the Old West Burger and the award winning Jalapeno Guacamole Cheeseburger. WOW! For the same price as In-N-Out or Five Guys, we had seriously delicious gourmet burger's. We will be back to try everything else on the menu and tell everyone we know about it!

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Are you in the mood for some hot dogs or some other American diner food? Do you want to watch TV while you dine? Then Great Links is the place.  Firstly this particular Great Links is not that big so it can fill up pretty fast. I like how you can sit on the bar stools and watch them prep your meal. Everyone is friendly that works here. They have some TVs up showing sports stuff. Today was nascar and they even were having some specials in celebration.  Now for what really matter the food! I try to stop by great links every time I drive by. Go for their hot dogs or sausages. My brother usually gets the burgers. Today I went for a Reuben and it was tasty! I love the rye bread they use and the cheese melted perfectly on the corned beef. As a side I got the natural cut fries. I just love the darkness of their fries. And if you want you can get shoestring or tater tots. The root beer they have is good! They serve beer as well I believe.  I give 4 stars for Great Links classic American food and great service!

Reviews.Author: Garett
Reviews.Content: PW wanted wieners and when he's hungry, you're better off just going with the flow. Besides we had to give him an opportunity to make up for his food court fiasco the other day. Good call! I too am now a fan of the wiener.  Our waitress, Michelle, greeted us promptly, took our drink orders, and made a few suggestions for the midday meal. We went with three different kinds of french fries as appetizers and all were outstanding. Cheesy buffalo, buttery garlic, and grilled onions had us all drooling when they were brought to the table.   I opted for the Philly Griller. Covered with grilled peppers and onions, it was quite possibly the best tube steak I've ever consumed. PW got some sort of chili dog, as did IW (no relation).   They have root beer on tap as well as draft beers. Definitely coming back for a bite and a brew. Lunch for three was just north of thirty bucks and worth much more. This place gets pumping at lunch time but is definitely worth a short wait. Their menu is pretty extensive including burgers, fish and a variety of sausages.  A five-star experience all around. Even if you're not a fan of the wiener you'll be sure to find something to please your palate.

Reviews.Author: Jade
Reviews.Content: Alright so I've been here quite a few times and so far I think to stick with the hot dog, links/sausages offerings and sides. After delving off menu a few times, I think it's the most solid they have to offer.   My  favorites out of the hot dog is the Las Vegas chili dog or chicago dogs. I also often get the sausages, mostly hot links. Hot dogs are Boars head so they have natural casings or you can get other types without the snap, even a white hot dog/veal one. Sides wise their fried green beans with wasabi mayo is really good. To drink get Sprechers root beer off the tap! Also their raspberry ice tea isn't that regular Lipton soda fountain stuff, it's brewed so that is good too.   Stick with that and I think you'll have a good dinner here. Cheap, good American type food.  Seeing as they won some  best of  burgers,  thought their burgers would be fantastic, but it isn't any different from any old greasy spoon. Also fish type stuff, is pre battered so not anything you can't do at home with some Gordon's. I feel like some stuff is offered, just to offer it. I thought the turkey burgers, grilled chicken sandwiches and tuna melt were decent though.   My one thing about this place is that do not come at peak hours. I don't know if the owner is too cheap to hire another person but they really need more than one waitress, there's never been two waitresses I've ever seen. We went recently where it hit max capacity in this small place and she was in the weeds the whole time. It was hard to flag her down for some extra sauce, I had to wait a long time by the cash register, I just got up to serve ourselves some drinks (good thing I did not get raspberry tea that was behind the register). She already is running around like mad even when it's not a full house so they really need two people at least during the rush. It's not fair to the poor gal or to customers. I know it's not her fault, but some people were upset...and it sucks if she gets crapped on for something she cannot control at all. I'm going to stick with going only in the odd hours. I don't like going to a place and get no service.   Overall though, I like this place.

Reviews.Author: Joshua
Reviews.Content: First off great customer service. This is a small establishment with a lot to offer. Their focus is hot dogs and beer, but they also offer sausages, hamburgers and hot sandwiches. We enjoyed the Chicago dog, Parmesan French fries and the Italian beef hot sandwich which were all excellent. Worth mentioning was the homemade raspberry tea and the 10% military discount.   I will absolutely be returning here for lunch!

Reviews.Author: Jill
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I ate here and didn't order a hot dog! I wasn't extremely hungry yet intrigued by the grill master fries mentioned in previous reviews. They were everything I had imagined and then some. The grilled onions were caramelized to perfection. The fries were fresh and crispy. The thousand Island dressing was tangy and sweet yet not overpowering. The melted cheese was the perfect amount not to smother the fries completely, I was in french fry heaven! The service was super friendly and fast. I will return to try more menu items!

Reviews.Author: Jesus
Reviews.Content: Went to this restaurant on my lunch break since a friend had recommended it to me. I was not disappointed at all! Sat down, placed my order and it was cooked right in front of me. I went with the philly griller dog and a side of italian fries. The griller dog was very good. The italian fries can use less parmesan cheese on them but thats just my personal taste so not taking a star away. The staff was real friendly and ready to refill my drink when needed. Food is cooked to order so don't expect fast food. Will definitely be back soon to try one of their other menu items.

Reviews.Author: S.
Reviews.Content: Went by today for lunch. I have to say the LV Chili Dog was as good as it gets!!! Place was clean and so was the service. Met Guy the owner and chatted with him for a bit...Nice person, It's like you have known him for years. Will be bringing my family by for lunch or dinner soon.

Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: Easily one of the best  hot dog/sausage  centric diners I have visited.  But, don't just focus on the tube meats. The sandwiches (pastrami, cheese steak, Chicago beef) and burgers are amazing too. The quality of the meats and large array of toppings are the difference makers; great recipes and service of hot and flavorful dishes are the best!!! Working our way thru the menu has been an adventure full of outstanding eats. Definitely try the white chili on dogs, sausages or burgers. Any of the fries are perfect - hot and super crisp. Can you tell I like this place???  LOL. Great service and a super talented chef along with willingness to make anything you can think of as toppings or prep make this an easy choice. Owned a small barbecue place myself, and these folks really hit every single mark.

Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Well first off, I have been excited to try this place for awhile, and unfortunately was let down.  When I walked in I was planning on ordering take out, and stepped straight to the counter where the menu was.  There were two guys (cooks) there in the open kitchen behind the bar, and there was zero greeting, so I decided whatever and seated myself as the sign says.  A young lady comes out and greets me and takes my drink order.  I order a root beer (which I was not aware that it was the non-refill type), the root beer was quite good and the highlight of the meal, so I will give it that.  I look over the menu a little more and decide on the chili dog and chili cheese fries, which I figured I couldn't go wrong with.  This is where my disappointment began, now I was pretty hungry not having eaten for several hours because of traveling so again I was looking forward to this...the fries were over cooked, and the chili had little to no taste, even after adding salt and pepper.  I ate most of them because I was hungry and they cost me good money.  Next was the chili dog which I was already worried about because of the fries, the dog comes out and it is pretty plain, just chili on top and nothing too large for $4+ and so I take a bit and yep I was right nothing special, same no taste chili and the hotdog is just average (Costco has better hotdogs), the cheap bun falls apart half way through for no reason (it wasn't the chili) and so that make it even worse.  Truthfully I wanted to just get up and leave as my server (who was a nice girl) had disappeared, and the two cooks wouldn't have even noticed or cared.  But I finished most of my meal and paid and left.  I wont be going back as there is nothing to go back for, tasteless food, average service, below average atmosphere.  And inflated pricing for what you get.  This is sad for me when I had great expectations for a locally owned place.

Reviews.Author: Natasha
Reviews.Content: I would l like to say I have a good review, but unfortunately not. I really think that service is the key to great reviews and even if the food or product isn't good most would at least consider a second chance in order for one's to redeem themselves just because of great service. But in my case that service never really came. I went to the place after work one night. After seeing it the day prior while on that side of town, I was excited to see something outside the typical here and there fast food. Plus it never hurts to see so many good reviews on yelp.  I drove out of my way that night and made it to the restaurant about 8:15. I admit I was apprehensive being out late and not familiar with the place and its operating hrs but after seeing a small group of what appeared to be customers because the waitress was serving them drinks and clearly reading the sign outside for a minute or so I proceeded in. I was happy to see a employee come hastily over to what I thought was  greet me but instead of that he rudely said that they closed at 8 and that I needed to go. I was shocked and embarrassed. He walked away never said sorry or please come again just walked away. I then left but not after reading the sign again which clearly stated 9 p.m. I also considered that the doors were still open. I sat in the parking lot and watched for a few minutes and also noted that no-one came to lock the doors which is standard procedure for most places when closing and not wanting any other patrons to make same mistakes but nothing happened.  I watched as the waitress continued to serve the group inside. 5 minutes passed and another tray of food came out to the group. I drove away quite upset vowing never to even attempt to come again. I suggest to anyone interested not to come after 8 or you just might be wasting your time because they clearly don't want to serve anyone according to the sign in the window. And maybe if the owners read this you will change the sign so no-one else does the same thing and you don't lose more of what could be potential customers.

Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: Best shake, burger and chili cheese fries ever. Our waitress Michelle was even better

Reviews.Author: Chelsea
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE Great Links. Now that I've moved from Vegas, I miss it all of the time. I used to eat here for lunch on the weekends, now I wish I'd gone even more. It's a small establishment on Craig Rd near 95, reminds me of a diner. They have many other options besides hot dogs, including brats and chicken, with vegetarian selections as well. There's a decent selection of beers, mostly bottles, and root beer on tap!  I always get the veggie dogs, and I wish I knew what brand they used. They taste better and have better texture than all other vegetarian hot dogs. The Chicago dog is my fav, and I also love the NY dog with sauerkraut and mustard. I definitely recommend trying their white Vegas chili, whether it's on fries or a dog. Sausage and sage is an awesome combination and it's delicious. Also, cannot get enough of the grillmaster fries, oh my they're addictive.   The service is always great. This place draws a local crowd, seems like many people know the owners/employees. I've had many different waiters/waitresses, eventually a few times each. Everyone is friendly and attentive.  I miss it so much ... keep up the great food and service and thanks for the memories! Don't change a thing!

Reviews.Author: Gretchen
Reviews.Content: Saw the reviews & came for lunch with the hubs.  Definitely hit the spot! We ordered the chili cheese dog, chili cheese dog deluxe, crinkle fries, & cheese stix. Sad we forgot to order the root beer on tap & just washed everything down with cherry coke. Anyways, service was great, our waitress was friendly & knowledgeable.  My 2 complaints: 1) having pre-shredded cheese is way convenient but the results you get from shredding from a cheese block, just doesn't compare. So, food for thought, buy a block of cheese & a cheese grater. 2) melt the shredded cheese before it is served. The look of waxy pre-shredded cold cheese on top of the delicious dog was slightly unappetizing.  But other than that, the dog was delicious & perfect size:)

Reviews.Author: Erik
Reviews.Content: I'm going to abandon my typically structured article and opening 'cliffhanger' paragraph and just skip right to it on this one: this sucked. Great Links' website claims right on the main page that they were voted the best burger in Las Vegas (!!!!). Who were they up against? This is insane! I know everyone has their own opinions, including me, but out of the 70+ burger places I've eaten at in town I'd say 95% of them are better than this. Who the hell voted? What other places was this up against? Come on!  The restaurant interior is typical strip mall fare, with the griddle and deep fryers right in the open. The menu features hot dogs, sausages, burgers, sandwiches, fish...you name it. The key words to this menu are: frozen, premade, generic, and Boar's Head. Think generic pre-packed sausages and dogs, frozen patties, frozen fries... Sitting at the counter by the griddle I witnessed them pulling their sausages out of Boar's Head packages, frozen patties thrown right on the griddle, generic frozen crinkle cut fries dumped right out of their plain grocery store bags into a measuring bowl and into the fryer. While sitting near the griddle the only 'fresh' items I noticed were the pre-cut veggies they were pulling out of the fridge to throw on the griddle.  My frozen burger patty was dropped right on the grill to be overcooked with everything else on there. The meat was very generic, not that flavorful, and definitely not the winner of any 'best of' contest I can think of. There was a huge piece of tough, thick lettuce on the burger, a small amount of mushrooms I could barely taste, well-melted swiss cheese and a couple of thin tomato slices. The bun was grilled well, but extremely plain and non-existent. Nothing about this burger stood out, other than the fact I could find it in any backyard bbq or at an overpriced crappy food stand at any sports event.  The thin, overcooked generic fries were exactly that. I can't stress how ridiculously typical this meal was; I would give it a fairly negative review just on all that, but combine it with the 'best burger' claim and it infuriates me. To top it off my meal came to $13.26, which is equal to or more than plenty of other fantastic burgers I've eaten all around town that are definitely worthy of some best burger claims in many categories. I can't recommend paying to eat anything here because you could purchase pretty much the same ingredients at any grocery store and do what they do in your backyard. Argh.

Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: The garlic cheese fries are very yummy, so are the ones that taste like potato chips. I had the turkey burger with cheese and mushrooms on lettuce and tomato, no bun. Very good. Kids had cheese burgers which were a tad dry. Hubby had the Parmesan chicken sandwich, he liked it. Some cons: it's summertime and the place got hot even with the fans going. Cram too many people in at once. They have bar seating, but it's right on top of the grills. If you can, order to go. It's worth it. Very reasonably priced. Charlie, one of the servers is extremely nice.

Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: Busy little place, almost too busy for the size.  They make great food.  Hot dogs were good.  Have had there burgers.  Next time need to try out their philly steak.

Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: So as many of my yelpers know I'm a very dedicated foodie and today I stumbled upon the holy grail a place that took me back to the streets in New York while actually in Vegas. First of all I see a lot of good service in Vegas tend to be products of people from different places just being themselves but if you want the best service hands down you're gonna come to Great Links its the family you never knew you had. I promise you with Lisa on you'll never have an empty drink she's gonna come and make sure everything is 5 star and she's gonna laugh and have fun with you. But the king of the crop Mike the head cook. the grill master, the guy you want to cook at every barbecue you have for the rest of your life will find away to make the best of the best of whatever you want while many Maintaining great conversation. I know this will be a new weekly spot and its one of the only places we you can come and watch the news and have really educated conversation. All in all this is the best place in Vegas and all of everyone I know should come in

Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: This place rocks!  It's a burger and hot dog joint with tons of options. The service is always stellar and the food is delicious! They also have so many vegan and vegetarian options. The Italian fries are so good!

Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: I know, I know. Who goes to a place named Great Links Brewhouse and orders a Burger and ice water.  Well... that was me today.  Hey, they do have a sticker on the entrance and throughout the place that they competed on Burger Wars sponsored by Fox 5 so they must have decent Burgers.    I went with the Pastrami burger which was slightly over cooked with grilled onions, spicy mustard and melted provo with pastrami piled on top of a 1/3 LB meat patty.  Good combo, I do like a little heavier mustard on mine which I added. Besides the burger having a char to it this definitely satisfied my burger craving I had today.    To accompany my burger I went with the Italian Fries topped with Italian seasoning and grated parmesan cheese. These were tasty fries.  The parmesan began melting which made them even better half way through the meal.    Overall visit was solid, I will be back to try one of there monster dogs.  They have several varieties of topping combinations including the classic Chicago Style.  I think my first choice will be the chili dog. I saw one being brought to another table and I almost had to change my mind.

Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: OK I been here 3 times in 1 week. And they serve BEER! If there's one thing on the Menu you have to try its their Italian Fries (Crinkle CUT) & and Deluxe Chili Cheese Dog. Great now I have to stop in on the way home. This is one of the good one's Yelpers.

Reviews.Author: Dayami
Reviews.Content: So my husband wanted some awesome hotdogs, so after searching thru Yelp and reading their reviews we decided to give this place a try. Have to say that I'm so glad we did. It was a great find and now one of our favorite places to eat. The food and the service was great, and they serve beer!! Lol.. They have a great menu as far as choices for the hotdog, and they taste like a little piece of heaven, they are made fresh to order and serve right away. This is a grill and it is a bit small with only a few tables are available, but is worth waiting if you have too.

Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: Came here a long while back and gave the hot dogs a go (which were GOOD)...now I had a chance to try the burger!  Pastrami Cheeseburger ($8.29): 1/3lb, Pastrami, Provolone Cheese, Grilled Onions, and Spicy Mustard. Very good burger...very juicy and love the MELTED cheese! Lots of flavor in their pastrami as well...GREAT choice!  Also tried the Italian Beef Sandwich ($7.99): Simmered in Italian spiced Au Jus with Green Peppers. Not a huge fan of Italian beef sandwiches, but this was good overall.  And the fries :  Vegas Chili Cheese Fries ($6.59): Sage Sausage White Chili, Pepper Jack Cheese, Tomatoes, Cayenne Sour Cream, and Spicy Mustard. This was great, with lots of spices in the sausage/chili and sauces. A bit HEAVY on the mustard, but still enjoyable.  PORTION was too big, so I took the rest to work with me, and somehow they still tasted good HOURS later...what the??  Italian Fries ($3.99): Garlic Butter Sauce, Italian Seasonings, and Parmesan Cheese. These were very good! LOTS of garlic flavor...yum!  I had these last time I was here and knew we were gonna order them again this time!  I'd recommend these most outta the bunch :P  Service is fast and friendly here.  I need to stop in more often :)  Pics :

Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: I love this place I work nearby and I try to get in there at least once or twice a month. Everything on their menu is fantastic. I absolutely love the patty melt. It reminds me of my youth and old-time diner style food. The only complaint I have is that they are way overdue for expanding and next-door is an empty space.

Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: Yum!!! Great place if you want to be a fatty! The western chicken sandwich is my favorite and the grill master fries are like in & out animal style fries but better because you get to choose what fries you want. The fried mushrooms are really good too.

Reviews.Author: Miyone
Reviews.Content: I originally started going to great links for lunch and dinner but one day I stumbled in there earlier in the day and discovered a breakfast menu. I lucked out that day because the breakfast is delicious. They serve fresh eggs potatoes biscuits and gravy and you get any link you choose to add to Your breakfast. The staff is nice and friendly and your sure to have a good time. Sometimes it's gets busy and its wait but well worth it. Long story short anytime of the day you can go to great links and enjoy a good hearty meal

Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Great food, large portions, great price and great service. What else can you ask for? This was our first time here and Charlie helped us make some great choices.

Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here several times and have always had a dog or a brat and have never been disappointed. I love to sit at the bar and watch the grill team work. They are in perfect synch...one guy on the grill, another on fries and a third expediting. And the taste is dynamite. They range from classic combinations to interesting. They also have burgers and boast of being top rated in Vegas by Fox News. So, I had one. It was good, but not great. The burgers alone wouldn't bring me back....but the Dogs...Heck Yes!

Reviews.Author: Melanie
Reviews.Content: AWESOME-SAUCE!!!! This was our first time here, so Charlie had us sit at the bar & briefly covered the whole menu for us & provided us w/ some info abut the place. He was SO nice!  Hubby tried the chili dog & I had the Chicago dog (minus the sport peppers). They were DELICIOUS! i'm not a chili fan because I don't really care for beans. Well thiers was pork & didn't have any beans, so it was sooooo good!! Also, I didn't know what sport peppers were & another guy working the grill turned around & handed us a small cup of them to try! ALL the employees there take care of you!!! Oh, thier fry sauce was awesome, too! Will definitely be back! AND.......it looks like they are opening up one by the base in the old Blueberry Hill building! Can't wait!!

Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Long story short, my wife and I came here after reading many great reviews and we were not impressed. The customer service was really bad and the fries were both over cooked and soggy (I didn't even know that was possible). It was not even busy and it took 10 minutes to order. We even sat down our menus and put them on the edge of the table to make it blatantly obvious. Then again, at the end of our meal it took forever for someone to bring us our bill. We came back home and wrote our original bad review, but it appears they paid to have it removed. I have now been insulted in their restaurant and on the web, thanks.

Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Been coming since they opened (and even prior when he had a cart outside lowes!)    Been about 6 months though and decided its been too long.  As always, friendly and good food - never disappoints. Chicago dog, mobster dog, grilled cheese and the oh so sinfully good fried pickles.  Forgot what I was missing.

Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: I, the hot link snob & my daughter are out running errands and we come across this place called  Great Links  we decided to give it a shot cus why not? In 20 years (2 decades) I have not had a decent hot link from a restaurant until Yesterday!  This was one of the best dang gone hot link I have ever had!  If u are a hot link snob desiring a hot link then this is the place for u and u Must try their natural cut fries (in house made potato chips) they are ridiculously delicious & so addicting! Also The root beer is on tap I highly recommend & I will definitely be back to try the burgers  )

Reviews.Author: Mia
Reviews.Content: Located very close to where I live and have shopped at neighboring businesses but never stopped here.  Went last night and what a surprise!  Had no idea they would have such an extensive menu.  Robert was awesome - watched him interact with other customers and his customer service was the best!!  Had the Cheese Steak Philly Style - Excellent!  Will be making Great Links a regular stop on my way home from work!

Reviews.Author: Allison
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to check this place out when I was in the area for a doctors appointment. Wow! Talk about tasty artery clogging food! Leave your calorie and carb counting at the door this place is worth it!  They use Boars Head brand hot dogs. They are the perfect start to all their hot dogs and they have tons of them anyway you can think of. They also have tons if burgers and fry options. It was very hard to pick what we wanted because everything sounded good!! We both choose the Philly dog with cheese sauce. Joel ordered the mushroom and Swiss burger. Of course we had to pick cheese fries and onion rings. I ordered a whole dill pickle, but they were out. They were super apologetic about it and instead gave me pickle spears for free! The food was excellent and messy! Be prepared to use ALL the napkins! The hot dogs had a snap to them and could totally be eaten with a fork and knife. The fries were crisp as were the onion rings. Great Links even offers fry sauce. Joel's burger was also tasty and moist. Perfectly cooked too! ( It's hard to get a perfect medium burger sometimes.) We both left so full.   I wish they were closer to us, but Great Links is totally worth the drive. If you have the serious munchies this is your spot! Their menu is huge and reasonably priced. Plus they have cheese sauce!!! You can't go wrong with that!!!

Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: This is a great little spot. I have been going to for years. Another little mom and pop spot, and those are my favorite.  They have a great variety of dogs, burgers, sandwiches, and appetizers to choose from. Although I haven;t tried it all (gimmie some time) everything I have tried has been great. When you're all done get a shake or a float to top it off..hell ya.  This is a small place so word of advice if you go during peak times, plan for a wait or you can also order and eat in the patio that sits a couple of stores down.

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent meal in this unassuming restaurant. What drew is here was the fact that they have vegetarian substitutes for every menu item, so both my husband and I can eat off the menu. I had the vegetarian slaw dog with chili. It was delicious! My husband had the Chicago dog which he enjoyed. We shared the Italian fries which we agreed would be a reason alone to return! The service was quick and friendly. We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Author: andy
Reviews.Content: Previously called Famous Uncle Al's Hot Dogs & Grill  -could not change the name on the other listing so I started a new one  What I ordered:  Dr. Pepper Las Vegas Chili Dog $4.40   - white sausage sage chili, pepper jack cheese, dill relish, tomatoes, cayenne sour cream & spicy mustard   As I waited for my LV Dog, I was looking to see what kind of beer they had on tap. They have Amber Bock, Sam Adams, Bud Light, and Root Beer...wait... what? (does a double take) ROOT BEER on tap?!! I don't think I've ever seen this before. When my server brought my LV Dog out, I asked him how the Root Beer was. He brought me a small cup to try and told me they get it from Milwaukee. The root beer and my LV Dog were yummy!  I am definitely going to come going to come back and try a root beer float (made w/Breyers Ice Cream).

Reviews.Author: Sib
Reviews.Content: This hole in the wall place caught my eye and I am glad that I took a chance and tried it.  I am a big fan of burgers, but I don't eat them very often.  This casual place in a strip mall next to Lowes and Qdoba at Craig and Rancho has amazing food.    This place was full at dinner time on a Friday night, and many of the customers seemed to be regulars.  I ordered the Ortega Bacon Cheese Burger (the name might be a little different, not sure) and it was great.  I did sub swiss for the pepper jack, and the result was a little less heat than I would have liked, but that's my fault. It was still delicious, with high quality ingredients.    The shoestring fries were hot and fresh and one order is more than enough for two people.  Try it with one of their fry sauces.  I can't wait to go back and try one of their hot dogs, which they have made for them by Boar's Head.     Two soft drinks, one order of fries, one burger and one cheesesteak cost about $19 before the tip.  The service very good, and they were prompt with refills.     It is not a dive, but it is definitely a place where you will find people in flip flops and shorts.

Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: I am a sucker for family owned bar and grills, but the food here makes it easy!  The Pastrami cheeseburger was absolutely delicious, the price was amazingly low, and the beer is cold.    I'll be back to try out the rest of the menu.

Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: Best hot dogs and sausages in the city. Super friendly staff, great prices, and a good kids menu.

Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: Found this place on yelp after craving a good hot dog. Good food, Nice atmosphere, and great staff. I tried the Atlanta Slaw Dog. I loved the homemade slaw. Definitely going back to get another and try the other hot dogs

Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: Ok, I've seriously died and went to Artery Clogging Heaven!  This place is Awesome!  Among other things, I really enjoy Burgers & Hot Dogs....and this place has plenty of it!  There were so many things on the menu, I didn't know where to start.....  So, I went with a Pastrami Cheeseburger (Pastrami, Grilled Onions, Provolone, & Mustard on a Burger)....and a Regular Hot Dog.  Since I was dining solo, I sat at the counter behind the Grill.  I waited patiently and watched the short order cook prepare the artery choking goodness for all the patrons and myself.....that was fun.  After about 10 minutes my order was up.  I went after the Pastrami Cheeseburger first.....wow, it was tasty.  I liked the proportion of Pastrami to Cheeseburger.....some places put too much Pastrami and it overwhelms the burger....not here.  I also liked how well the Grilled Onions tasted.....they were chopped in med sized pieces which I prefer to the larger sized ones you find in some places.  It was so good, I didn't add anything to it....I ate it as it was served.  Next, I added some Mustard to the Regular Dog and bit into it.  I felt a familiar ~Snap~ as I took that first bite.....awesome!  You don't find too many snapper dogs around town, so I was pleased that I did.  Every bite was full of Hot Dog goodness.  There are so many varieties of Dogs & Burgers here, not to mention side dishes that I want to try.  Will I return?  I guarantee you I'll be back at least 10 times to try other stuff on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: Hot Dog Heaven. First, I love hot dogs so when I found this place shortly after moving here I was so excited. The dogs themselves are perfect, with a nice snap at each bite. They offered a huge variety...I had the cheese dog with cold cheddar (rather than cheese sauce or melted cheddar) and my husband had a chili cheese dog. Both were delicious. We we're impressed with the variety of sides (fried pickles, zucchini, tots, fries, etc) and the draft root beer was awesome.

Reviews.Author: Ernest
Reviews.Content: You can actually see how they grill because it's not hidden. Very fast service, makes you feel at home. Sometimes those hole in the wall spots are the best. Try the Ortega burger its so delicious.

Reviews.Author: Lostin
Reviews.Content: Excellent Philly Cheese Steak Sandwich.  Cheesy, meaty, lots of onions and peppers.  I would not change a thing.  Fish Sandwich is big and fresh.  Friendly quick service.  Next time I go back I will probably just order the same thing again.

Reviews.Author: Madeline
Reviews.Content: This place is super close to my house and have been coming here for years. If your looking for yummy comfort food then eat here! The staff is super friendly and they always recognize us when we come in! We always sit at the bar, we like watching the food get cooked! Great family owned establishment. Great prices. Extensive menu options and yummy food!   **TIP: This place can get very busy, only one fry cook and one griller. But it's well worth the few extra minutes it takes to get your food!

Reviews.Author: Ric
Reviews.Content: Great hot dog and sandwich place in my neighborhood. Nice little beer selection too. The fried pickles are good. Check this place out if your craving a good hot dog.

Reviews.Author: Robyn
Reviews.Content: Hospitality is top notch as usual. As for the menu, it is more than great dogs.  Ask your server for suggestions if you are stuck or don't see exactly what you want. I usually get soup to complete my meal. They are super helpful in concocting exactly what you want. Also can order ahead if you are in a hurry!

Reviews.Author: Kenny
Reviews.Content: There is a reason that Great Links won the burger wars competition.  This place is amazing.  I love when a small business like this can beat out the competition of a major chain.

Reviews.Author: Bobby
Reviews.Content: Great food, speedy and efficient service and great prices. Vegetarian options are good too

Reviews.Author: Barry
Reviews.Content: Today was the first time I've been to this place, so it took me awhile to read through the menu to decide. The server was understanding, brought me my drink, and let me work my way through the menu.   They have many choices for hot dogs, sausages and burgers along with many other choices, I almost ordered fish and chips.They had a chili burger, normally I make sure whether it's chili the red soup stuff or chili the green pepper, reading the description it said white chili, since I had no idea what that was, I asked the server. She brought me a sample. It's made with a sage sausage, it's a lot like the country gravy I make for biscuits and gravy.  I ended up ordering a patty melt. Cheese, grilled onions, burger on grilled dark rye. It was good, not great, but good. The burger patty was lacking, it appeared to be a frozen formed patty, dry after cooking. The preparation, of the sandwich, was great, with a fresh burger patty, that was still juicy, it would have been a great sandwich.  The server, I didn't get the name, an attractive young lady at lunch time on 6/19/2014. She was friendly, helpful, attentive, everything a person in customer service should be.   I've read all the reviews, they allude to the burgers winning awards, so my burger may have been an aberration. I would say, I will go back and try a burger again, but after reading the reviews about the snap in the dogs, I want to try one of them. Funny thing is, I saw the Great Links sign and I actual went in this place for a hot dog, got lost in the menu and ended up ordering a burger.  I believe the 1/2 lb patty melt, I had, was about $7.50, which is about the going price for this type of sandwich, so the price is reasonable.  I will be back, you should give it a try.

Reviews.Author: Trina
Reviews.Content: Great Links is a great place for a great meal.  I love the food choices, and I especially love the people that work there.  You can get a snappy dog with tons of toppings for cheap, and some killer fries, including my favorite--the Grill Master Fries (it's an acquired taste, though): fries tossed with thousand island dressing, grilled onions, then topped with melted cheese.  Ew?  Maybe.  For me?  Yum. :)  If you want a nice place to run in and eat, check them out.  And if you're brave enough, grab some grill master fries. Don't blame me if you think it's crazy and weird. I warned ya!

Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: I know, I know...5 stars for hot dogs? But I love this place. It's easy, it's clean, the people that work there are happy and have a good time. AND there is nothing healthier than leaving the gym to have a hot dog and fries...so try their hot dogs!

Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: This is just for the hamburger.. See my reviews for the other stuff.. I don't see how they won the burger wars.. It's a frozen patty and taste like it too! The lettuce became so soggy so fast it stopped my bite, it wouldn't tear at all, when I tried to bite into the burger the whole slice of lettuce came out without breaking off.. I tried to pull it apart with my hands and couldn't!! I'm not weak either.. I think I found something stronger than 550 cord. I was disappointed as everything else here is so awesome!

Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: We found this place on yelp. The dogs were great.  I tried the mob boss and who knew that combination could be so good.  My husband tried the slaw dog with chili and wanted a second one.  Good place, would come again.

Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: I'm a woman who knows her way around a dog - both the male variety and the frankfurter type. Ok, no more man bashing! I like men, might even review them as a a group, However, decided not to resist the joke. So, no offense right? Plus, I'm about to tell you all about a great place. so forgive me, this one time. Ok, locally owned, which I LOVE. Family has fought hard to keep the place going and has had some incredible challenges, including the wife's battle with cancer.  However, they remain committed to good food, good service, and good attitudes. I know they won a burger competition put on by Fox 5. Not much staff turnover which tells me a lot. They had a coupon in last year's Entertainment Book.  I haven't checked the new one.  Haven't seen them on Groupon or Living Social. I need to check Restaurants.com, Prices are fair without a coupon though and they have meal deals. Before I forget, they offer some very interesting vegetarian options. I would order one to try it, but who am I kidding? I'm there for the dogs. Sometimes, I'm there for the clams. Sometimes, for the rueben, but never for the veggies. Wait, do breaded and fried mushrooms count? Incredibly large menu, which I'm sure they do to please customers but must be hard to maintain. They even do breakfast. My favorite is the Atlanta dog. Not to be a diva, but I special order mine and they always remember.  I like the dog in the natural casing.  They do the dog a little longer for me. They also take the cole slaw out of the fridge before they start the dog cause I don't want cold slaw to cool off the hot dog. Ok, feel free to groan. I swear I didn't mean the pun. I try to be a woman of integrity, so I'm going to leave it.  I also like the red onion sauce - that might be the NY dog. Shame that I was born in NY and I'm not sure which is my dog.  Doesn't matter cause the dogs are described on the menu. :Plus you can order whatever you would like. I'm not much of a fry girl, but you need to order them here.  They offer different kinds and great toppings.  They have beer, which I haven't had yet.  Well, I've had beer, just not at Great Links. They have ice cream and shakes, both of which I have had and enjoyed. Great local place with quality junk food. I'm not sure it gets better than that.

Reviews.Author: Keely
Reviews.Content: Another great hot dog place; been there a few times. Great selection of hot dogs - chili, Chicago and Vegas dog are my favorites. Coupons in Entertainment Book

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Vegas and my good friend had taken me and my wife there on the way to our hotel. I had no clue what this place was but it was really cool. They have a lot more than hot dogs. The beer was cheap, the dogs were good and the desserts were not bad either. I had a Boston Dog and it was better than I thought it would be. Its a small place so good luck finding a place to sit on the weekend. This place was good enough for us to go back before we had to go to the airport to come home.  Peace Out  MZ

Reviews.Author: Raqi
Reviews.Content: Words do no justice... this place serves out of this world hot dogs with all kinds of fixings.  It was seriously hard to choose which one to order!  But no problem, since hubby and I will definitely be going back to sample more!   This time, I ordered the New Yorker - topped with onion sauce, sauerkraut and spicy mustard.  The casing snapped when I bit into it.. heaven!  My husband tried the Chicago style and it disappeared down his gullet in seconds!   In addition to hot dogs, they also offer bratwurst, Italian sausage, chicken sausage, kielbasa, (+ more but I can't remember all the types now), also crisp fries with all kinds of toppings, burgers, fried shrimp, fish and chips, salads, etc.  The place was hopping when we visited, friendly staff, happy eating people - a winning combination!   For me, a real Northwest Vegas hidden treat!

Reviews.Author: Colsie
Reviews.Content: Today was my first time in this great little spot! I loved the laid back atmosphere and the burger was probably the best I've had in Vegas! I decided on just a regular burger with everything on it and chedar cheese fries and the whole table ended up eating my fries. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: I've always lived by a rule of thumb that if you go to a burger place you have to get a burger, if you go to to a pizza place you get the pizza. So when I was coaxed into a hot dog place (not my ideal food) I decided to deviate from this plan, and I was shocked. Everything I've ordered from this place is great. They have had amazing burgers, chicken tenders, and they some how improved the mozzarella sticks by offering them as half moons.  Not the cheapest place in the world (My combo meal runs me around $11) I've introduced a few people to this place as well and they all enjoy it. The place is either empty or teeming. They have great carry-out which I recommend to everyone who may not like busy places. (Yet no matter how busy they get, you always get taken care of, or if you're impatient, you can just get up and get your own refill) It's a nice mix between casual fast food and a sit down restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Kish
Reviews.Content: Seventy Nine reviews to date and a solid four and a half star rating for the best hot dog & hamburger joint in the United States, yep, I said it, the BEST hot dog & hamburger joint in the United States!!!!!!!  I can't remember the name of this place when it first opened but I do remember falling in love the first time I walked through the door, every city in the United States should have a great hot dog & hamburger joint but alas, it is not to be.  If you go here expect a line because great food joints have lines and Great Links usually has a line, if there is a line just wait till a seat opens up, it is worth the wait.  First the staff, these guys and gals are AWESOME .............. this place is like Cheers and even if they don't know your name they will make you feel at home.  Now the food, where to start ................. EVERYTHING IS AWESOME!!!!!!!  They offer two styles of hot dogs, the natural casing or as they would tell you, the casing that  snaps , and the skinless casing. Both are 100% beef, I am a skinless guy myself but I have had both and I would not turn down either.   There are twenty nine, yep, 29 different hot dogs & sausage items on the menu and they are all mouth watering, remember when you were a boy, how freaking awesome is summertime delicious!!!!!  the Las Vegas Chili Dog is the bomb, the Philly Griller Dog is delectable, the Mob Boss Dog is exquisite, and the Louisiana Hot Link is Extraordinary.  I love their old school crinkle cut fries, the burgers are tasty, juicy goodness and don't even get me going about the atmosphere of the place .................. it is one of those places where you feel at home the first time you walk in the door.   OK, I just gave a hot dog & hamburger joint a five star review after promising my fellow Yelpers that I would reserve my five star reviews for the best of the best, so in other words ...................... NAILED IT!!!!!!!  Until next time fellow Yelpers ................. Be Local, Live Local, Buy Local!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Great find in an unsuspecting location! The menu here is kind of busy so you might have to ask someone to explain all the details to you. But after Charlie broke it down for us we decided we would need to come back at least 4 times to try everything. Great in house made root beer and great deals for beers. Great plus is their ***vegan/Vegetarian*** options with tons of add on options. Family of 7 ate for just over $70 with beers sodas and other drinks and don't forget your 10% discount if you are in the military. Only thing stopping a 5 star rating is the busy menu... It was a bit overwhelming.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Once again in Vegas hunting down great gluten and dairy free food with good taste.  We came to Great Links looking for their organic salad, but they were out.  It turned out awesome though.  Most of their sausages and hot dogs are gf!  And they were happy to make a grilled chicken sandwich protein-style for my friend.  My polish sausage was beautifully presented.  The French fries were yummy and the homemade fry sauce was plentiful and quite excellent!  Really loved the root beer on draft.  (It took me back to my Midwest days.) Michelle was super cool and took wonderful care of us.  Everyone there was really friendly.  We'll definitely come back.  Later note... Something had gluten unfortunately.  I think it was either the butter alternate used to grill the onions or the special fry sauce (malt vinegar?).  Ask if you are super sensitive.  They are really nice.

Reviews.Author: Christie
Reviews.Content: All the hot dogs here are Boar's Head, but you can choose skinless or a turkey dog. Walking in there were several employees that greeted us. We chose a table near the window and started looking through the menu. The menu offers a variety of not just hot dogs, but also sausage, burgers, sandwiches, chicken, fish, and salad.    Given the name, I had to try a hot dog the first time! Priced at $4.59 I ordered the  Philly Griller dog  that had grilled peppers, onion and cheese sauce. Yum! I couldn't even eat the whole thing so half went to hubby who didn't care for the char taste, but I like a good charred dog. The peppers and onions had a great flavor and there was a fair amount of cheese sauce. I also had some  Italian Fries  priced at $4.29 and had my choice of shoestring or crinkle-cut. I chose the shoestring and it was tossed in a garlic butter sauce and topped with parmesan cheese and Italian seasoning. These were good! I asked for a side of ranch to dip them in and the ranch was good. Our server was nice and checked on us often. I do feel the restaurant could be cleaner inside, but there was a good vibe and I'd go back. You can place your order for pick-up as well.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Quite possibly the best Hot Dog I've ever eaten!  This place warrants 5 stars not only because the food was great, the service was excellent and our party even received a free hot dog because the waitress mistakenly thought we ordered an additional hot dog and ended up just giving it to us anyways.   I'd highly recommend the Chicago Dog.  It had the right amout of crispness and bite.  The onions were savory and the dog itself was pretty spicy.  This place is also very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Author: Christian
Reviews.Content: Had been eager to give this place a try and now I regret even stepping a foot in the door. Service was elementary at best but the food was absolutely horrible.   Appearance wise, food got an A+ but once we took a bite it was very disappointing. My wife had a patty melt which had no flavor while I had a Philly cheese steak that had everything but the steak. The bread fell apart as soon as I picked it up and lacked flavor as well. We were really eager to try this place out but ended up disappointed. Sorry but ain't coming back

Reviews.Author: Alisa
Reviews.Content: Great place to go have a hot dog and watch the game on TV. Also the kids meal is only 4 dollars and got my hungry child full lol. Only reason why I'm giving it 4 stars is because the hot dog was a little small and I was sad. Other then that the fried pickles were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The philly dog was super cheesy and the peppers were super tender. Nice vibe and great service! 2 thumbs up

Reviews.Author: Liz
Reviews.Content: As we were watching a movie my partner and I watched someone eat a hot dog so next thing you know we're yelping to find a good hot dog place. Since I don't eat beef I called around to a couple places to see if they served turkey dogs (yes I know I'm going to get stuff for eating a turkey dog but whateves). Great links had turkey options AND vegetarian options which is awesome! As soon as we got here we were greeted(can't remember his name :() but he was really nice and even made suggestions since we've never been here. I ordered a Chicago dog and a root beer float(delish, have one). My partner ordered a mob boss with a order of chili cheese fries. Everything was on point!!! A must have!!!

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: The best grilled cheese sandwich you can get in Las Vegas. Especially with bacon.

Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: After craving a hotdog, I pulled out the technological equivalent of a crystal ball that is the yelp app.  GLB&G seemed the place to visit for lunch during the work week based on the reviews.  Easily located using the technological divining rod that is the yelp app, the team rolled in after the 11:00 hour.  Parking was a breeze as was the seating despite the potential for tight quarters during a rush.  The menu boasts over 152 hot dog and sausage combinations.  Again, according to the menu, their hot dogs are custom made by Boar's Head.  Your gonna get 7 1/2 inches of natural cased beef and pork.  I set my sights on the Deluxe Chili Cheese Dog w/ chili on the side.  The contents included cheddar cheese, bacon, onions and jalapeños.  What really got the party started was the portion of the menu containing the specialty fries!  Once again, the menu states there are over forty different combinations to customize your order.  We decided to order three off the menu with only a few minor tweeks at the recommendation of our on point and truly wonderful server, Michelle.  They included the following:  Italian Fries- With Italian seasoning, parmesan cheese and a tasty garlic butter sauce on top of recommended crinkle cuts fries.  Next up was the Buffalo Cheesy Fries- Recommended tater tots tossed in a mild buffalo sauce, and topped with melted cheese. Grill Master Fries- Recommended shoestring fries smothered in cheese, grilled onions, and thousand island dressing.  As the baskets of addictive potato masterpieces came out to the table, and they allicited multiple OMG responses.  Their beauty was only matched by their taste as they dropped on my tie and on my lap of which I did not care... I was in a high starch and fat high.  Once I came to, my boss was kind enough to offer their water so I could spot clean.  My dog was good but nothing compared to fries which could have easily been meal onto it's self.  All this goodness was washed down with a 22 ounces glass of Death Vally Root Beer.  They also serve beer.  Next to the root beer a cold glass of golden nectar would be an amazing means to compliment the meal!  I look forward to retuning in the very near future and experiencing the happiness that is GLB&G!

Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an exceptional burger or dog this is the place!! Awesome staff, great service and beer! We got the the fried mushrooms to start then had to get an order of Itialian fries. I had the jalapeño guacamole cheese burger which was evertything i wanted in a burger. I highly recommend this place, they were awesome to bs with too!

Reviews.Author: Courtney
Reviews.Content: Very good hot dogs. Loved the natural casing. It almost reminded me of the hot dogs I use to it back home.

Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: Great little spot that took me forever to go to. Great hotdogs and fries. Try the turkey dog, you can't tell the different. I'm going to have to come back a couple time to try all of the different combinations there are.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: After seeing Peter A's review, I totally had to check it out. I've been craving a burger lately but didn't feel like traveling too far. Plus who can pass up a hot dog! We walked into a pretty crowded place on a Sunday at 1pm. We sat down and ordered some drinks. My husband and I debated the menu for a bit. There were so many things that sounded so good. We finally decided on an order of buffalo cheesy fries, a guacamole jalapeño burger for me, a pastrami burger for hubby, a corn dog kids meal and a kraut dog to share.  Buffalo cheesy fries - slightly tangy sauce with melted cheese. They weren't salty or spicy but were good. Guacamole jalapeño burger - I devoured this. The guacamole was creamy. There were just enough jalapeños to give it a little kick without overpowering it. Yummy deliciousness.  Pastrami burger - I took a bite. I just had to. It looked too good. The mustard had just the right kick. The pastrami complimented the burger in such the right way.  Kraut dog - oh snap... Literally! It was so good. Just enough spicy mustard and kraut. The kraut was crisp and wasn't too sour.  Corn dog - nothing special. The stick said Foster's Farm.   This is going to be my local go to for a good burger and hot dog.

Reviews.Author: Z
Reviews.Content: How have I not been here before?!   So good!!!  Had the fried mozzerella and I swear it was the best ever.  I know that is hard to screw up but it came out so damn perfect I was in heaven. Pastrami cheeseburger was even better! Friendly efficient service and good prices. This place is pure awesome!

Reviews.Author: Colleenie
Reviews.Content: Ohhh I wanted to like it! We live in Henderson, so it took a lot to convince my roommate to drive the 30 miles one way -- I had to offer to pay LOL so off we went. I ordered NY Street Dog, waffle fries & BBQ Western Burger w/bacon. I have to admit when the food got to the table, in the cute little bar style baskets -- I turned to my roommate and said  disgusting . It was so gross, to me (and I'm from the west coast) but it was all Chicago style -- like a mess. It wasn't the type of food you can just pick up and eat, the bun - from both the hot dog and the burger were just saturated, wet, soggy, mushy like dough like gross - which is where my  disgusting  game from. So the hotdog was some type of pressed meat type of hot-dog, like a cheap hot dog and it was not grilled. It was not a good, high quality hot dog at all. What I didn't like was it was all pink - inside and out I don't know I like my hotdogs grilled with like grill marks on the outside. This dog sat down in the soggy bun covered with sour croute and mustard. I bit off the one end and pushed the hotdog over to my roommate. He cut his burger in half and gave me half - same thing, and I wanted to take a picture but I felt silly - it was a big piece of mush. Seriously like ¾ of it had been dipped in BBQ sauce........... It seems like the BBQ burger had some kind chili on it or something but it was all over saturated with BBQ/Chili sauce. I took a bite, the burger itself seemed like a good burger - and I did like the actual meat of the burger itself but as the BBQ sauce got all over my hands and fingers it was a mess, yucky - I set the rest of the burger in its basket and pushed it away. I went to the bathroom to wash my hands. Oh ya and they were out of waffle fries - so we opted for the  natural  fries, which ya, were very greasy. We ate all of the fries, because we were hungry and both of us not too happy with the meals - the little sauces that came with the fries was good  some kind of Cajun sauce and what seemed to be tarter.  Like I said I wanted to like this place, I like the décor and the waitress was very nice but this place is not my style. I'll continue on my personal search for a great Las Vegas burger.

Reviews.Author: Clovis
Reviews.Content: I've been several times, and recommend to everyone... however, I brought an out of towner this past weekend, and was pretty disappointed. I got the wrong drink, my burger was wrong, and we only got one of our fry orders. Hopefully the next trip way over there will be worth it...

Reviews.Author: Joni
Reviews.Content: I can taste why this place is usually hopping. Good dogs, cold brews, very casual and comfy.  Come as you are. Great prices, too. Last time, my upgraded  ballpark dog was as good or better than at Cashman Field or any other ballpark I've been to. Hah.  Today, BF having classic chili & I'm going for the Streets of New York dog with light sauerkraut, spicy mustard. Always gotta upgrade to the 1/4 lb all beef dog in a grilled hoagie bun.  Mmmmmm!

Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: Ate here with the whole family today and we enjoyed every bit of the food! The white sausage sage chili on the new Las Vegas dog is fantastic!! Highly recommend a stop here! The service is also outstanding!

Reviews.Author: M
Reviews.Content: Great Links is the only place I've found in Las Vegas that has both a vegetarian hot dog AND vegetarian chili, enabling me to have a veggie chili dog. Plus, the atmosphere is unique and the staff are helpful. We recently made the twenty minute drive there craving what only they offer. When we arrived, there was a sign on the door saying they were closed for a private party. We called from the parking lot, and they made our food and brought it to our car with many apologies and some free Oreos. :)

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Honestly, one of the best burgers I have had in a long time! Better than anything I've had at Bobby Flay's place,  Bobby's Burger Palace . Very good quality and cooked perfectly.

Reviews.Author: Victor
Reviews.Content: I had the grilled Ortega pepper bacon cheeseburger. It was delicious. Perfectly cooked and well seasoned. The service was friendly and prompt. I will return.

Reviews.Author: T
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend wanted to try this place because his coworkers highly recommended it. So we visited on Sunday evening. As soon as we opened the door, we saw a guy cleaning grill, then the guy yelled  F@#$  as soon as we locked eyes. My boyfriend and I walked right back out. Although another gentleman motioned for us to come in, we decided not to. Granted we walked in 10 min before closing, however we should not have been greeted like that.

Reviews.Author: Imari
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed, rushed across town to make if before closing (which I did at 8:58 pm) walked in and asked young lady if they were open and she responded yes? Minute later, man doing closing chores yelled they were closed yet I'm still standing inside of establishment and young lady is ready to ring me up? Go figure!!! I won't be coming back here ever! I'll make my own great link...

Reviews.Author: Eddie
Reviews.Content: The hot dogs were good. They have a wide variety.  There bacon cheeseburger is great. Fast service however I had to refill my own drink. The waitress just pointed to the machine and said she was too busy. That was a bummer. But as far as taste goes.......they get a 3 star.

Reviews.Author: Sergio
Reviews.Content: Great place to eat good portions big menu its always a struggle to decide everything I've had here has been excellent from cheese frys to the links amazing. Only thing its a small space and I have a big fam and it gets pretty crowded sometimes but over all the food and service trumps all. They also serve one of my fav beers on tap amber bock plus a good bottled selection highly recommend.

Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: I went here during the lunch rush on a Friday and this place was packed.  I was able to grab a table right away because the gal was quick to keep them bussed.  I ordered a number two thinking the dogs would be small like a Nathan's dog or something you could get at a grocery store.  I was wrong, they are big enough to need their own basket.  Luckily I was able to talk my husband into eating the second one for me.  Even though the place was busy, we were checked on four times.  I walked out the door stuffed and the bill, less than 20 bucks.  I will be back.

Reviews.Author: Lillie
Reviews.Content: Was really excited about going here. It's close by to our house and we enjoy hot dogs. We went in and it took the cashier a couple minutes to come over and just ask us if we where ready. She seemed annoyed. We told her it was our first time and we'd like to look over the menu first. When we where ready she took our order, Chicago dog, Louisiana link, cheese fries and house salad. $20 for it all. Seemed pricey for me. We where asked if we wanted to eat here. We really would have loved to. But it was overwhelmingly hot in there. It felt like a sauna. I know today was probably the hottest days in Vegas, (114 on 6/7/13) but when you want to be inside on a summer day, outside shouldn't be hotter. We took our food home. The Chicago dog tasted good, it was soggy, like all the juice from the toppings where Just added to it. The hot dog tasted good, them seem to have a good product, only problem was, the restaurant was hotter than my dog. The Louisiana link was good. Spicy! No complains there. The cheese fries, I would suggest not getting. They where soggy. It almost seemed like cheap frozen fries from the grocery store, microwaved and drowned with cheese. We where only able to eat half because the other half wasn't even removable from the paper wrap in the container. Salad, I couldn't tell you because the didn't include our dressing. And after our experience, didn't really feel like going back. I don't know if we would have received better food if we ate in or not. We weren't too pleased. Won't be goon back. We'd rather go to weinersnitchel. They seem to have a good thing going on. I'll just be weary if you go in.

Reviews.Author: Lupita
Reviews.Content: It was ok. Wouldn't come back though. Not sure why it has over a 4 to be honest. We were greeted rudely and it took forever to get our food, compared to the couples around us, who all arrived after us. The waitress was nice-ish, but didn't know a single thing about the menu. She told us our sandwiches came with things they didn't, and kept asking us to repeat ourselves. They never refilled our drinks. They also forgot one of the items of my order, and brought it out once we were done and we reminded her. Don't order the clam chowder, it wasn't good, barely any clam and you could tell it was heated in the microwave. The Italian beef/ sausage combo is okay. The sausage was much better than the actual Italian beef part. Overall, not a good experience. Won't be coming back.  Side note: party of four; came in around 6:30 pm.

Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Awesome sausage dogs and hamburgers. Today we tried the Italian fries, BOMB! My son had the sage chili on his dog. After several times of trying it I have finally decided that I do not like the sage chili. It is to aromatic strong and tasting. Cool idea though.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: Since discovering Great Links about a year ago my husband, son and I eat here at least 2-3 times a month (it's our go-to place on a Saturday/Sunday afternoon). After all the times we have eaten here, we still haven't even scratched the surface of their menu! Everything I have tried has been absolutely amazing! So far my favorites are the NASCAR specials (I really wish they would still serve last year's special though) and their Italian fries. The prices are extremely resonable, we usually order 2 dogs (or burgers/sandwiches), 2 orders of fries, 2 soft drinks and a kids meal (includes drink and cookies for dessert) and I don't think we have ever paid more than $25.   The quality of their food is top-notch and the food is always served piping hot and fast. The thing that really makes this place worth visiting is the service. I always see the owner there which is a true sign of pride in ownership and Michelle is one of the hardest working people I have ever met. The place is always packed with people and yet the staff manages to keep everyone happy and they do it with a smile on their face even though you know thay have got to be exhausted!   They also keep the place very clean both in the dinning area, grill area and the restrooms. One of my biggest pet peeves is a dirty bathroom... I have been know to actually walk out of a place because of the condition of the bathroom (I'm kind of a germ-a-phobe when it comes to public toilets), I can honestly say that Great Links has one of the cleanest bathrooms I have ever seen in a restaurant.  I've heard through the grape vine that the owners are having some financial trouble recently and despite the success of Great Links may be forced to close their doors. I truley hope this does not happen. I tell everyone I know about this place in hopes that the increase in business will help keep this place going even though it means they will be even busier and I will probably have to wait more, it is definitely worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Liz
Reviews.Content: I found this place on Yelp when I was looking for a good place for our group of 7 to eat lunch. Our group order the Ruben which was very good and I had the jalapeño burger and it was one of the best burgers. The chili cheese fries and fried pickles were outstanding. The place was packed and I can see why, the food is delicious and the whole group was very happy.

Reviews.Author: Curtis
Reviews.Content: Not to often I want a hot dog for dinner, so when the craving hit , we headed to great links because of the great reviews. I had the New York style( onion sauce saurkraut)  the weiner it self had a nice snap when u bit into it , the onion sauce was like a watered down ketchup with onion pieces in it. The bun was kinda soggy at bottom , maybe supposed to b that way ? Never been to New York,  so I don't know, but  I find it hard  to believe a new yorker or anyone for that matter would buy this hot dog at a cart only to have it drip all over them.            We also ordered the pastrami on rye , the meat was plentiful,  but a little salty for me , wife said  not salty , may be me.                                   We also got fried zucchini and chili cheese fries . The zucchini was awsome nice batter and crispy. The chili cheese fries were good , chili tasted like canned stuff to me . The sides zucchini & fries came out first , we were almost done with the sides then came the hot dogs. It was not busy, so the wait confused me. I don't think hot dog should take so long .  The menu is huge and looks intresting , so I will b back to give it another shot.       Service was friendly, but a little slow.

Reviews.Author: Hector
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas Chili Dog, Deluxe Chili Cheese Dog and Italian Tots. Washed them down with a 22 oz draft beer. Yum. Even the jalapeños on the deluxe dog were crispy. No complaints here.

Reviews.Author: Fidel
Reviews.Content: This place is AWESOME!!!!!!  We moved to Vegas about a year ago and this is one of the first places we found that we love.  We've tried everything on the menu and love it all. In fact, we eat there about 4 or five times a month... The Philly Cheese Steak is INCREDILE!! Philly Style... Hot Links, Hot dogs... Oh and the burgers are off the chain.. The bread is so good. Not an average bun its really good...  I rarely write reviews but I simply had to do this one.. This place should have multiple locations in Vegas...

Reviews.Author: Joelle
Reviews.Content: I had this whole review written here about how great this place is and how you should get this and that and the other thing, but Yelp ate it and I'm spent.  So, go eat here. They're awesome. Great staff. Good food. 10% off your order when you get an entree, side and drink. Sigh.

Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: This is a grill, cooked to order in open kitchen. This is a great place to meet a friend, have a cold beer, great dog, watch a game, tease the staff (they flip it right back). Now this isn't a family atmosphere, or a place designed with high end service or patient wait staff... this is an old school grille...like it should be. Try a Mob Boss Dog with Italian Fries..and a freaking cold beer..    Good job guys!

Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: The people were really nice and the food was pretty good. I got a chicago dog and a cheeseburger. The chicago dog was decent, I'd order it again. I heard they won an award for their burger, so I might be in the minority here, but the burger patty reminded me of those perfect circle frozen patties you might buy at the grocery store. Not really fresh and juicy like some of the award winning burgers I've had elsewhere. My friend got a polish sausage and said it was really good.   I'll be back to try out some more of the menu and hopefully give em a higher rating after.

Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: Super yummy sausages and nice, fresh tomatoes and excellent dill relish! Great variety between dogs, sausage and burgers. Fun sides and really nice people! Go check them out so they stay open!

Reviews.Author: Rusty
Reviews.Content: Let's get down to the food (even though the UFC was playing - extra points!).  I had a Chicago dog and my wife had a cheeseburger, and we split an order of fries.  Brilliant. And the price was rockin'! Will definitely be back. Staff was very friendly...ie, when the fries were done they brought them out so we could start eating while the dog and burger were still cooking.

Reviews.Author: Marcus
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome... Some of the best dogs I've had... A lot of different choices done up however you like... The Philly cheese is on a  whole notha level  as Key & Peele would say... One of my new favorites spots that feel familiar when you walk in...

Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Found this on Yelp.  Amazed to find that it was a former Famous Uncle Al's since we come from Virginia Beach, the birthplace of the Uncle Al franchise.  Great links has expanded on Al's menu in a good way and we all enjoyed our picks from the big menu.  if you are in Virginia Beach, stop in the original Famous Uncle Al's on Shore Drive and meet the man himself - it's an experience.

Reviews.Author: Cat
Reviews.Content: I came here with my boyfriend and my 2 daughters. My boyfriend had heard great things about this place so we had been wanting to test it out. The service was awesome. As soon as we walked in we were able to find a table that sat 4 people. The waiter greeted us right away and also brought a crayon box and a stack of blank paper for my daughters to draw on. He went over the menu with us and gave us recommendations on what he liked. Also let us know how the menu worked and that we could put any toppings on anything. Very nice guy, I even had a headache and he was able to give me some Advil. What waiter helps you out with that. Awesome! Our food came out in a timely manner and it was fresh and hot. Everything was great! It's hard to find good Chicago food along with good friendly people and this place has both. We will def be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Krista
